Last but not least, James Brolin,(Fabbrizio Disguisey),"A Guy Thing",'03, added his talents to this picture, but I began to wonder if Barbra Streisand enjoyed this film and her husband's performance. WOW

review_title: WAY too critical folks; good mindless, silly fun!
review_detailed_main:
I agree with Sex Baby from MA... this movie got a bad rap. If you want to see Dana Carvey in his element, being goofy and playing a bunch of different characters . . . if you know you're watching a movie that's an Adam Sandler production . . . if you just want to kick back and enjoy some silliness (especially fun watching with kids), then this movie can't be beat.

IMHO, the "laugh quotient" ranks up there with any Jim Carey movie (mention Jim Carey because he was originally offered the part, and would have fit the part played by Carvey well too).

What the heck; if you choose Master of Disguise for what it's worth (ie: you're looking for a movie to evoke some mindless laughter), and you have even a semblance of a sense of humor, you won't be disappointed.

review_title: A sometimes lame kid's movie, yes. But one of the worst films ever? Never...!
review_detailed_main:
I consider myself a film buff, I write professionally, although only on rare occasions do film reviews, so I feel I have a few more credentials than your average armchair IMDB critic. All that said, I have never seen such intensely horrible IMDB reviews (e.g. `the worst ever') for a movie that actually wasn't that bad. Its no great work of art, but I actually enjoyed watching it through adolescent eyes. It's was intended as a kid's movie for Christ's sake! Its supposed to be stupid with goofy repetitive gags and lame humor. But done with a good wink and a nod, if anybody was watching. People saw Dana Carvey's name on the label, thought it was going to be the next Wayne's World or whatever, and were disappointed when it wasn't. But Dana's charm is there in spades, I loved all the characters he created in this senseless little movie, and the story actually wasn't much lamer or thin than Wayne's World's 1 or 2  if you want to complain about plot within comedy skit-driven movies.

Its also pretty obvious from the brevity of the film (only 65 minutes of movie), and the fact that a heap of scenes in the 15 minutes of end-credit outtakes are not in the film, that this flick is an abbreviated version of what Carvey and director Blake originally intended. Who knows what were the reasons, but I'll bet even money that some cost overrun, studio intervention or other problem resulted in at least a third of this film winding-up on the cutting room floor.

Before watching this movie, just put yourself in the same mind frame as `Spy Kids', but without all the big budget special effects, gadgets and elaborate sets, and you'll probably have a much better chance of enjoying what you see. I can see why some folks might only give this movie a 4 or 5 (out of 10), but one of the worst films ever? Never!

review_title: Minimal value, not recommended for any age
review_detailed_main:
What eye-catching opening credits! What a cast list! What marvelous production design, and art direction! I've been well aware of the film's reputation from the time it was released, but I admit some aspects impressed me after curiosity won out and I began watching. The picture is popping with color both literal and figurative in the set design and decoration, costume design, hair and makeup, and lighting. In smaller, more careful moments of interaction between characters, I think the ensemble illustrates some of the acting abilities we know they have, demonstrating some cheeky nuance. Why, as silly as it is, I think the concept has strong possibilities as an outlandish comedy. And the sound design! Even on a basic, cost-friendly laptop, the audio experience is frankly incredible.

I'd love to say that 'The master of disguise' surprised me, and was characterized with still more quality than I anticipated. But that's simply not the case. There are, in fact, some instances where the humor is just right, where the movie achieves a level of farcical energy that earns a laugh or two. These are far outnumbered by instances in which the comedy is hopelessly cheap and juvenile - such as a recurring quirk illustrated by the villain - or outright scatological. Bewilderingly blunt, plainspoken jokes and sight gags, if done right, can add an unexpected cheeky spark to a scene; here, they mostly fall very, very flat. Referential humor is rarely clever, and only dates the picture, while modern pop songs are emphatically inserted at times when they could hardly be less appropriate. The sheer number of costume changes that star and co-writer Dana Carvey has through the runtime is supposed to lend to the exaggerated fun, but that fun is missing in the first place, and the costume changes instead only seem pointless. And then there are the fat jokes, the racist stereotypes, xenophobic caricatures, and sexism.

In fairness, there's no mistaking that this feature is intended as a kid's movie. The unswerving simplicity of the plot development informs as much, as well as a lot of the dialogue, and no one but an adolescent could possibly find some of the humor here actually funny. With that said - maybe I was just born a cynic, but I recognize in 'The master of disguise' an astonishingly low grade of would-be amusement. I know to a certainty that if I were 8 years old and seeing this for the first time, I would have been altogether embarrassed to watch it with another person, and I probably wouldn't have enjoyed it any more then than I have now.

This is well made from a technical standpoint, and I do appreciate the contributions of the cast, but what does this truly matter when the comedy is so abysmal? As if to emphasize the point, the small clips shown throughout the end credits, including bloopers, are far actively engaging than the feature, with more (unrealized) potential for laughs. I gave it a try, I really did - I've watched plenty of films that were not regarded well, only to be delighted by how good I thought they were. This is not one of those films. 'The master of disguise' not only consciously rejects the intelligence we know Carvey is capable of as a comedic actor, but frankly patronizes children with its assumption that only the most base humor will provide their amusement. What value this does possess - and it does, indeed, have slivers of value - is far outweighed by tedious, unfunny pablum. Sure enough, there are worse movies you could watch, but few that are as visible and easy to find as this one is.

Not recommendable, for any age group.

review_title: Dumbfounded, likely the worst movie I've seen
review_detailed_main:
First, I'll say that I believe this movie is a large, steaming pile. I have to ask, for anyone who says they enjoyed this movie, did we see the same one? I found little entertainment value, and indeed cringed at the attempts at 'funny'. When the funniest bit in the whole film is a guy farting every time he laughs, the movie needs some serious work and/or revision.

What I believe this film suffers from is a case of bad editing, more than anything. I can see where some of the jokes would be funny, some of the pratfalls could have given a laugh or two, and how some of the disguises could have been pulled off with hilarity.

Instead, I saw a movie with heavy-handed attempts at humor, with timing intended for very young children. Indeed, if it were not for the main character's attraction to large butts (about the only sexual tones in the movie), and the drawn-out plot line, I'd say it's a movie intended for children between the ages of 2 and 5.

Perhaps if the time spent trying to make the audience 'get it' were cut out, or some of the over-the-top characters given snappier lines, the jokes could have worked. Then again, it would have shortened the movie to about 30 minutes.

Dana Carvey seems to be trying to be like Jim Carrey or Martin Short, which is a shame. I have to ask, when he saw the final edit, did he think it was good?

I have wasted my time on movies before, such as "Leonard, Part 6", and "Ishtar", and I gleefully toss this movie in that category.

If I could only get my 2 hours back.

review_title: Not the best, but definitely not the worst.
review_detailed_main: I accidentally taped this movie one night a long time ago, when I was about 9 or 10. I watched it the next day, and I thought it was hilarious. Granted, that was 4 or 5 years ago, but I still think it's a pretty funny movie. Dana Carvey is a comedic genius, and I thought his part in this film was fantastic. The fact that he masquerades as a lot of slightly retarded and incredibly funny characters is probably the reason why. I look at this movie and I think, now why couldn't I do that? This movie is definitely aimed at audiences who love low-brow, stupid comedy, but for a movie that is aimed at those people, it is actually fairly good. It could have been a lot worse. With quite a few laugh-out-loud moments, this movie redeems itself from the amateur acting, many goofs, and silly storyline. The acting is . . . reasonable, for a movie of this standard, and although the storyline is beyond silly, it fits the whole comedic theme of the movie. So, this movie will be okay for anyone who doesn't mind stupid comedy and is just looking for a laugh.

review_title: Is this supposed to be for kids?
review_detailed_main: So I saw this film for the first time when I was 8. Of course as an 8 year old, I found this film to be hilarious, but I recall my mother finding it absolutely stupid. I remember every kid in my school was talking about the film and quoting it not long after it came out. Now I have re-watched this film as a young adult, and I'm constantly wondering who was the intended audience for this film? The film is rated PG-13, and it's obvious because some of the humour is inappropriate for children. Ironically, most of the humour in the film would only be funny to someone under the age of 12. Overall, the film basically feels like a watered down, more childish imitation of Austin Powers. I can honestly see why this film has been long forgotten by the majority of the population.

review_title: "Master of Disgust" is a more suitable title.
review_detailed_main: Of all the bile-inducing vomitoriums to squeeze out of Tinseltown's bloody sphincter over the past 50 years, this is indisputably the worst of the lot. Carvey's one-man show is such a poor excuse for comedy that it doesn't even deserve to get raked by the MST 3000 crew. I swear, I actually felt nauseated after watching this festering pile of manure. In order to lengthen the lame 70-minute running time, the producers padded the end credits to TEN minutes with lame-ass Carvey impressions that surely couldn't even make the last few minutes of that God-awful Saturday Night Live TV show. In it you can see Carvey imitating other notable actors who surely don't deserve the indignity. Did I mention it features Jessica Simpson in a cameo? Yech!! If you ever plan on watching this stinking puke-fest, you might want to make sure you have plenty of Pepto-Bisthmol beforehand.

review_title: 2023. A Gen-X Review of a Decades Old Film That I've Never, Ever Seen Before
review_detailed_main:
You've got to admire the commitment. You've got to admire the devotion. One and all to this project.

Someone somewhere said Dana Carvey is a comedic genius. And we are going to create something that shows this. Every single bit of it.

The man can do anything and we are going to put that up there for everyone to see this.

Well, they really tried. They really did.

What I got most out of this is Jennifer Esposito.

Wow. Wowie zowie. She always looks good in everything she's ever in, but here especially so.

She's never looked better.

Another good thing about this movie, is that it's short. So, for this reason it's totally worth watching.

For well under an hour and a half, you have Jennifer Esposito setting the screen on fire, Dana Carvey giving it his absolute all in a movie that really fits the early aughts.

Also some excellent cameos by Bo Derek, Jesse Ventura and Jessica Simpson.

It's not a good movie but it's worth the time allotted.

This was one of the worse movies i ever saw , I really wasn't expecting much & was very disapointed . This movie was just plain Stupid !!!! The Best part of this movie was when i returned it to Blockbuster !! all in all Master Of Disguise it tied for the worse movie i ever saw & i can't remember the title of what it's tied with but it's a lame ripoff of Revenge Of The Nerds

The 'Jaws' and 'Scarface' jokes alone, are worth to see this movie. Primarily targeted at a younger audience, 'Master of Disguise' is a comedy that won't offend anyone and it's got its moments of genius.

Dana Carvey does an out of this world impersonation (quite literally) of Al Pacino in Scarface and a lot of other interesting ones too. Spiner proves once more that he is a genuine comical talent, as the likable villain.

Dana Carvey is worth so much more, but 'Master of Disguise' isn't bad. If you've got kids, they'll love it.

10/10 (Out of respect for Dana)

review_title: funny, dont believe the bone heads
review_detailed_main: I think it's funny that people here that are knocking this film, would probably laugh at dopey movies like Jim Carrey does. Stuff Karl Childers (sling blade) would enjoy watching saturday morning cartoons. It's not stupid comedy. I think the ones who dislike this one expect dumb slapstick comedy rather than the kind that Carvey delivers here. I rated it a 6. Not the best I've seen but certainly does not deserve the insulting 1 votes here. Give it a try and don't believe the bone heads.

review_title: Must be seen to be believed.
review_detailed_main: I like Dana Carvey. I've always thought he was funny from SNL to his own show on ABC. I even liked his film "Clean Slate" and "The Road to Wellness" wasn't that bad. But this film is arguably the worst waste of talent, celluloid, energy, or any other resource for that matter that has ever been put on film. Not only is the film not funny, it is difficult to even sit through. Had the plot developed out in a more tongue-in-cheek manner, it probably could have worked, but there would have to be a plot first. The character names alone give a hint at just how bad this film is. How do films like this get a green light? Who really thought this would be a hit? This film is an exercise in how to end your career and leave little chance for it being resurrected.

review_title: You Have got to Be Kidding Me
One of the worst... not from this year... EVER!
review_detailed_main:
I can't believe I actually sat through the whole thing. My 6 year old even thought it was bad. It is possibly the worst movie I have ever had the misfortune to spend good money on. I found myself discussing movies like "Plan 9 from Outer Space" with my wife on the way home. At least "Plan 9" was funny.

Dana Carvey is generally funny, and this might have been funny as a Saturday Night Live sketch, but it wears on the nerves. The character played by Carvey comes across as stupid with few redeeming traits that make you want to see his life get better, and for the most part he doesn't get any smarter.

And just like a bad SNL sketch, you wish you could fast forward to the next sketch, unfortunately there isn't one.

How did it only rank #38 on the worst 100 list? Terrible script, no acting, no plot .... it is difficult to believe it was made at all. Hopefully nobody counted on getting anything for their points. Dana Carvey is a one-trick pony ...and the trick isn't all that good!!!!!

review_title: And The 2002 Razzie Award For Worst Picture Goes To...
review_detailed_main: Really, to think that Dana Carvey, a master comedian who was part of the best SNL cast ever (any SNL fan can back me up on that one,) was part of such a lousy film. Funniest thing in the film is the villain having a flatulence problem.

review_title: Stupid goof ball film that shows how low Dana Carvey has sunk
review_detailed_main: After great movies like Wayne's World and it's sequel, I was happy to watch Master of Disguise to see how Dana could show off more of his acting talents. Oh my gosh! This film is too childish and stupid for adults and no kids under five would like this film. To many baby scenes like with Dana falling onto his grand papa inside a fat suit that has blown up over it's usual weight. The disguises are all unique but some are too stupid, like take the German with the big teeth! Dana is not funny at all with his stupid impressions and his goofy jokes that are not funny at all. A few scenes are good like the Mr. Peru scene, I liked that which is a homage to Scarface's Tony Montana. But the villain is too predictable and he has a stupid farting problem, his henchmen are to dull, and the whole idea of coloring the movie to match it's main actor for purpose was just too idiotic. Can you kill ninjas by slapping them, can Jesse Ventura steal the liberty bell, are there masters of disguises? NO! This film is pure rubbish, skip this film. You will be happy without it. Bad Dana Carvey, bad!

review_title: Could Have Been So Much Better
review_detailed_main: 9 March 2003. The most entertaining part of this movie was the ending credits - not that the credits were bad, they actually were funny, with out-takes and probably one of the longest lingering ending to a movie ever. Dana Carvey really missed an opportunity to write and make a breakout comedy here. Unfortunately, the talent of Mr. Carvey is wasted because of too many silly jokes, discongruent scenes, and a pretty flat comedy movie. There are brushes with attempts at great comedy here, but they are not enough to save this movie. If only somebody had been really serious enough to spend more time with the script and make it into a focussed, thematic, serious comedy attempt, then this movie might have done a lot better. Dana tries some new stuff, but experimental comedy is one thing, but using a feature movie to try it out is another. I made it through the entire movie, including the end of the credits which must mean something, but the movie wasn't as funny as it could have been and some of the characters played by Dana just weren't interesting or enjoyable. This was a kid's movie that tried to be too grown up about it and failed. Five out of ten stars

review_title: It's a kids movie - and one that they love!
review_detailed_main:
I was a mere 8 year old when I first saw this movie.

I fell in love! This was a movie I rematched 15 times per week.

20 years later, I sat down and watched it with my 6yo, 4yo and 1yo.

While it didn't entertain me the way it did as a kid, it is still an enjoyable KIDS movie.

And the kids... They couldn't stop laughing! Just like I remember being those many years ago.

The reviews for this movie are harsh. Rating it on their personal opinions as an ADULT about a KIDS movie. YOU AREN'T THE MARKET!

To my kids, this movie is 10/10.

It's easy to watch as a parent, so I say that's a win. 8/10.

Admittedly, this is a utterly silly movie. However, I laughed my head off at Dana Carvey dressed as a turtle going into a night club, making "turtle" noises. It is a movie that perhaps needs a little laughing gas or good companionship to help you slip into its groove. Its humour is reminiscent of the Pink Panther scene, where Dreyfus and Clouseau, stoned on nitrous oxide, laugh at Dreyfus's melting face. It is a vehicle for Carvey to show off a parade of weird accents, mannerisms, and theatrical false teeth.

The running joke is watching people react to Carvey, trying to figure out why he is behaving so bizarrely, but somehow intimidated by his insanity.

I once read that the best way to get a row of seats to yourself in a plane is simply to chew on a piece of string and let it droop out the corner of your mouth.

Forget you are a film critic. Let the kid in you enjoy this the way you enjoyed Jerry Lewis at the Saturday matinée.

There can't be a movie worse than this. Why won't they let you enter a vote less than 1? This movie makes battlefield earth look like Casablanca. I've watched a lot of children's movies with my son, and none are as bad as this, so this movie can't be for children. sometimes you watch a movie and want your money back, but you can't put a price on the anguish that this causes. All parties responsible for making this should be locked up so they can't hurt us again. The instructional video that they show new employees at Kinko's to clear a paper jam is The Godfather compared to this pile of crap. Whenever Goodfellas or Casino comes out, Italian-American groups complain about negative stereotypes, but Dana Carvey's character is called Pistachio Disguisey, and talks with a corny pseudo-Italian accent, and nobody says a word. I'm not Italian, but if I was, I'd rather have people think I'm a gangster than a no talent hack named pistachio disguisey. If anyone needs to sleep with the fishes, it's anyone associated with the making or distribution of this so-called film.

This is the most lame, unfunny, difficult to understand movie I have ever seen. I actually contemplated buying the DVD just so I could smash it against the wall. Don't just walk but run away from this nightmare of a movie. Dana Carvey is much too funny to have actually conceived this brain-dead idea. I'm hoping his next venture will be better; however, in comparison to this bomb - a movie about animal cruelty would be funnier than the Master of Disaster.

review_title: I could not believe how bad this was !

review_detailed_main: i went and saw this the night it came out (dont know why), it is easily the worst movie that's come out in a long time, chud 2 was more entertaining. even tho this was meant as a children's movie i wouldnt think even children would find it funny

review_title: Too bad this "movie" can't disguise itself as a comedy.
review_detailed_main: "The Master of Disguise" (2002), this might as well be called "How Not to Make a Movie". This "film" is yet another one of the top 10 worst movies I have ever seen. I remember when this "film" first came out, I was in elementary school. Back then, I was kind of interested in seeing it. But, I never got around to it, or even buying it on video. Yep, that was still during the VHS transitioning to DVD era. I never saw it when it was first released, and thank God for that! Just over ten years later, I saw it On Demand for free. So, I thought: "why not? I think I'll give it a watch." What a waste of 80 minutes of my life! I'm just all the more grateful that I didn't watch it as a kid. If I did, it would most likely have taken away half of my brain. Seriously, who green-lit this steaming pile of garbage?! This "movie" has a boring story, horrible acting, dated special effects, dull sets/locations, and a cheap generic soundtrack. The "story", or lack thereof, is one of the most dull and cliched I have ever seen. When I watched it, there was no laughter, there was no enjoyment, nothing salvageable at all! This "movie" is only 80 minutes, so it doesn't sound like it's that long. But when I saw it, it felt like I was watching it for days! Another thing, is that this "movie" has an extremely long end credit sequence. For a movie to clock in as a feature film, it has to be a minimum of 70 minutes to reach movie length standards. The "movie" ends after 65 minutes of runtime, and then there's the infamous 10 minutes plus end credit sequence, but even that's not the end. After the credits, there's not one, not two, but three post-credit scenes! All three of them go absolutely nowhere, and tie into nothing, just like the rest of this "film". However, there are movies where a long end credit sequence can work if it goes along with the context of the film itself. Like, if you want to showcase some bloopers, a behind the scenes featurette, etc. When executed properly, long end credits can be fun to watch! But that is not the case for this "movie". One thing to point out, the "most popular" scene is the Turtle Club scene. That, supposedly, is supposed to be the comedic highlight. It appeared the most frequent in all the commercials and trailers. Believe me, I know! But, when I watched it, I was very disappointed (big shock). It's nothing but Dana Carvey in a cheaply made costume shouting "turtle" over and over again. Boring! As for the acting, where on Earth do I begin? All of the actors do a horrible job, especially Dana Carvey, who plays the main character, Pistachio Disguisey. No, seriously.... That's his name! Before I tear apart Dana Carvey's performance, I just want to say one thing. I don't hate him as an actor overall, Dana Carvey is a great comedian. He has played good roles in other movies, and I do enjoy watching clips of him on "Saturday Night Live". Dana Carvey is famous for voice impersonations, and that is the concept idea for "The Master of Disguise". Now that's a decent idea, and it surely had potential. But it was just so poorly executed! Dana Carvey gave one of the unfunniest performances I have ever seen. He just smiles with his mouth partially open for 95% of the time. Listen, that may entertain kids under five years old for an hour. But if you're older than that, watching that expression for over a minute will want you to pull your hair out! Don't even get me started on his over the top accent. Wow, as if his annoying expression wasn't bad enough! As far as the rest of the actors and actresses performances go, they all suck pretty much as bad as Dana Carvey's. The special effects are dated, and have not aged well. All of the sets/locations are dull and boring, and all the interior scenes are obviously filmed on a sound stage. Now I don't want you to think I'm against sound stages, when utilized properly, they can look like a real life setting. A movie with perfect use of sound stages is "Flubber" (1997). Most of the interior scenes are filmed in a studio, but are properly laid out so it's not obvious where it's actually filmed. Back to "The Master of Disguise" review. As far as the soundtrack goes, it's just as cheap and generic as the rest of the "movie". Bottom line, there is nothing positive I can salvage from this waste of film making. I'm giving this "film" 0 out of 5 stars on my scale. If I could rate it 0 stars I would, but 1 is as low as I can go. Ignore the 1 star rating, my true rating is 0 stars. "The Master of Disguise" is a waste of cinema, and is not worth watching even if you have an opportunity to watch it for free. Life is too short to watch it, go watch real movies instead. Turtle!

review_title: A reject SNL sketch masquerading as a feature film
review_detailed_main:
This movie is what happens when the Borat-quoting kid in class grows up without ever learning the difference between good and bad attention. Carvey is so monumentally unamusing that he robs better actors of their dignity simply by being in the same shot. This poorly conceived excuse to trot out a series of mediocre impressions and hackneyed characters starts out trying too hard, delivering a protagonist who is actually named Pistaccio Disguisey, then limps across the finish line by padding itself out to feature-length with outtakes, dance sequences, and full-on deleted scenes peppered throughout the credits.

To give you an idea of the quality of humor you're dealing with, the biggest running joke is a character who farts periodically. That's it.

And in case you were wondering if the titular master of disguise gets through this movie's feeble length without painting his face brown and doing a truly cringeworthy Indian accent, no, he absolutely does not clear that hurtle.

I didn't expect sophisticated humor, but this film was a total mess. . and a shame. Dana is abundantly talented, but like Martin Short, crafting a film to spotlight that talent remains an elusive challenge. I hope he gets another chance to do it right. c

review_title: The only thing disguised was the humor

review_detailed_main: This movie is definitely weird but it still cracks me up.

review_title: If you were expecting some Blockbuster film, go home....
Worst Things to Happen to Italians
review_detailed_main: The Master of Disguise is uniquely unfunny, extraordinarily irritating, and it is baffling that it was made and distributed at all. While some films are 'so bad they"re good', the Master of Disguise falls just shy of that, remaining bad. With very few redeeming qualities, the cast manage to make it as enjoyable as they can with the scripts they're given. Pistachio Disguisey (Dana Carvey) might be the biggest offender, as his lead performance was nails on a chalkboard, put to film. With even the best jokes barely producing a smile, the majority fall flat in an incredible display as hard to sit through as a bombing stand-up comedian. The Master of Disguise fails to disguise itself as a decent film and instead entirely insults its audience from start to finish. I have never felt so disgraced to be an Italian.

I saw this film yesterday with my 7yo son, and it is rubbish.

I get to see a lot of kids movies and I usually can get a laugh or two but this was amazing for it complete lack of humour.

Don't see it it will only encourage them to make a sequel :-)

I took my 10-year old nephew to see this whilst on holiday in the US. Either he's more mature than his years or the film-makers have seriously underestimated what people will find funny. Dana Carvey doing his own thing, the fart noises, etc - my nephew asked to leave after 30 minutes. A joke heard once is funny, a joke replayed over & over again is boring, and a poor joke replayed over & over again is insulting. Credit people with some intelligence, film-makers - if you want to make something that panders to the ego of particular actors with almost total disregard for the quality of the film as a whole, then advertise it as that & your audience will be selected/selective accordingly. This was a waste of money to make & a waste of money to watch.

The Master of Disguise is a terrible movie that isnt even remotely funny. Its about the Disgusy family, who are all masters of disguise. But Pistachio Disgusy never knew about his heritage because his father elected not to tell him because he thought Pistachio deserved a better life then a life of disguising. When Pistachio's parents are kidnapped, he must learn to use his disguising skills to rescue them.

Don't waste your time or money to see this joke of a film.

Hi, I was extremely disappointed in the movie MASTER OF DISGUISE. My 10 yr. old says they kept referring to ladies rears as a consideration when looking for a spouse. The guy continually passed gas. Every piece of clothing the girl wore showed excessive cleavage- great for boys and girls to look up to don't you think? Isn't that how we want them to dress? and for the little boys to look for? RESPECT At the party they served hors d'oeuvres and I think they referred to the sausage link as comparing it to his penis,I'm not sure it was quick. Towards the end the guy tells the girl I want you to have my babies. This was not done in class or with taste. It should have been rated PG-13. The movie theatre was three quarters full of children . Please respond, I would like to here something from you. SHebert

I saw the commercials for this movie, and it didn't look as horrible as it was. The movie was so lame and I have never seen anything worse in my life. I hope to god that nobody thinks that this is Dana Carveys best movie. If you think that, then this is the only Dana Carvey movie you have seen. He was great in Wayne's World and was probably the only thing that somebody liked about Master of Disguise. Dana Carvey plummeted in this movie, and it is so awful. Who wants to see a guy who farts every time he laughs? I'm not putting down all fart jokes, but that one was just lame. This is the lamest movie that I have ever seen and is good only to use as a Frisbee or coaster, and even then, you will be disappointed by this trash.

review_title: Funny scenes to the movie, but overall stupid!
review_detailed_main:
This movie was on cable the other morning and I found nothing better to watch, so I sat down and found myself watching a movie that had some funny scenes, but an overall stupid plot.

Carvey is a waiter whose father (Brolin) has an alter ego. When his parents are kidnapped, his grandfather (Gould) shows up and shows him the reason why he is the way he is: Carvey is a master of disguise...he just doesn't know it yet.

With training from his grandfather (like some old karate movie) Carvey sees the light and becomes the formidable opponent to Spiner, who has blackmailed Carvey's father into stealing precious American historical item like the Declaration of Independence and the Liberty Bell (with cameos like Jesse Ventura and Jessica Simpson).

Like I said, some of the scenes did make me laugh, but the plot is not very bright...I thought my 12 year old daughter could have written a better plot. Out of 10 stars, it doesn't even make average: I gave it a 4, but only on Carvey, not the rest of the film.

Dana Carvey is brilliant; see him as a turtle and try not to laugh.

He does Al Pacino as a Saturday Night Fever dancer who flips all over.

The younger crowd cannot understand the movie, but we thought it was hilarious.

Many people went in to this movie expecting too much, and were obviously disappointed (you can learn a moral from that). If you do this, how could you ever expect a movie to live up to your expectations, doesn't seem fair.This movie was funny in many places, although it was rather slow in the beginning.There are many references adults would even enjoy. This is not Dana Carvey's best work, but it's not a waste (if you wanna go cheap, see it during a matinee).

I took my two children to see this film at the drive-in after they had been inundated with the commercials for a few weeks on the Cartoon Network and Nickelodean. They loved the scenes involving the Turtle Man that we have all seen in the broadcast previews.

Unfortunately, this scene as played in the actual film has moments in the trailer that are not in the movie. These happen to be the moments they found the most amusing. This was disappointment number one for them.

Disappointment two was that the film wasn't that good -- and they barely laughed throughout it. I myself felt lucky the film seemed to only last for about an hour. Then the credits seemed to roll on for almost as long as the actual film showcasing outtakes and additional scenes. It was rather obvious from watching these outtakes and additional tidbits that entire scenes and sequences where removed from the film. Lucky for us they were excised, unluckily they were left in the credits.

The saving grace for the entire night was that this was a double feature with Stuart Little 2, which they did enjoy quite a bit.

review_title: The most amazing thing about this movie.......
review_detailed_main: Is that there are people that have a high enough IQ to write a review, and actually liked it. One of the worst films of all time. I have not been a Carvey fan after SNL but you have to expect more from a guy with his comedic timing and characterization ability. I can only imagine how he must have felt when this wrapped and he looked at the finished product. I can only assume he missed the daily's as any reasonable person would have quit after the first day. That's how bad the film is. There isn't a single scene that isn't embarrassing. The characters are absurd, the acting atrocious, the plot non existent. No question, this movie is a wonderful example of why IMDb should allow zero stars for their reviews. It absolutely doesn't rate the one star I gave it. The idea that people would recommend this movie with a straight face only goes to show what kind of trouble the population at large is really in. I have to think the caretakers of those who enjoyed the movie wrote the review for them because nobody with a IQ higher than 50 could have thought anything other than this movie was an incredible disaster.

review_title: A film that would worked, if it had been a Saturday morning cartoon!
review_detailed_main:
When I rented this movie, I thought there was going to be a laugh a minute. I actually thought it might be the new Austin Powers. The preview looked funny and the movie could have been funny if the preview editors made the film instead!

The only thing me and my girlfriend found funny was the running fart joke.

I was sadly disappointed and recommmend people not seeing this, but if you must, spend no money on it, watch on tv in a year or so.

I used to love this movie as a kid. I think it's what got me into doing accents and silly voices. I used to quote what I could remember from it with a good friend back in highschool. I rewatched it again recently with my 6 year old sister, and when we got to the end she said "that was really dumb." And I had to agree. It was just plain unfunny. Even the things I've quoted over the years just weren't funny anymore. Just a bad movie that I wish my nostalgia goggles had protected a little more, I suppose.

This is one of the worst movies I've ever seen. The DVD should come with a warning label "WARNING: If watched, INDUCE VOMITING!!!" I felt truly let down by Dana Carvey, as I hold him in high regard due to his work in the "Wayne's World" movies. Also the preview for the film had good jokes in it... WHICH WERE NOT INCLUDED IN THE FILM!!! I saw the preview and found myself laughing hysterically at some of Dana's remarks and looking forward to seeing the movie (little did I know that such jokes as "the Neapolitan ice-cream" debate would be omitted to make room for crap like the fart jokes involving the ridiculous villain).
I get why people dislike this film, but beauty is in the eye of the beholder. This is one of the funniest movies I've ever seen and is my type of humour.

The first thing I have to say is that this is a kids movie. A kids movie, a kids movie a kids movie. It's made for children, and chances are, if you don't like it, it's probably because your not a kid. I babysat a 7 year old, and watched this movie, and I thought it was kinda cute for a kids movie, and she thought it was pretty silly. Now as an adult I thought parts of it where just dumb, but then again, I'm not a kid. The kids I've talked to seemed to like it, and even I liked some parts. I thought Dana Carvey did a good job with all those voices. Now before you see it, you must realize, it's a silly kids movie, and it has some toliet humor in it. If you don't like silly movies, or kids movies, or movies with toliet humor in it, don't watch it. But if not, then this movie is ok. I gave it a 7 out of 10.

I like Dana Carvey, I really do. In fact, me and my friends were kinda hopin' this movie would do well. It didn't. So I saw it. I'm sorry Dana, but what happened?

Amusing characters is one thing, but when the jokes rely on the "funny" way the characters are saying them, there is something terribly wrong. I always look for the good in movies and when I saw the delectible Jennifer Esposito (if you like her, check out her work in the little-known, decent indie "The Proposal") and multi-talented Brent Spiner, I had hope. But even they couldn't salvage this movie.

A weak plot, stupid characters names, a sheer lack of jokes, and SHAMELESS cameos (they even suckered poor Jennifer Simpson in), all work together to bring this movie down.

In closing, yes, Jim Carrey has made a living saying stuff behind funny faces for years... but at least what he's saying is funny.

Leaving the ladies smilin',

da_flipboy

review_title: Comedy will never be the same.

review_detailed_main:
The Master of Disguise is one of the worst movies I have ever watched. It is not funny and it is beyond stupid. I have never hated any movie in my life more than this. This movie sucks. Whoever made this movie should be ashamed of themselves.

Dana Carvey is a guy who thinks he is good at disguising but he sucks at it. Why doesn't he go join the turtle club and bite the people who made this movie? By the way, the whole movie is not about turtles. What is the point of the name of the club?

The only thing this movie would be good for is torture. Watching this films should be a new method of torture for the Hostel movies.

This movie is one of the worst movies i have ever seen (including Eddie Murphy's "Holy Man") and seeing it surely was the most wasted hour and a half of my life. Although Dana Carvey is a good impresionist, it doesn't mean a movie should be made about it. The movie had a few funny moments but they couldn't save it from the rest of it. I still don't understand why celebrities like Michael Johnson and Bo Derek agreed to take a part in this HORRIBLE production.

review_title: Only a child would find Carvey's performance funny
review_detailed_main: This had to have been made for children, because I can't believe that Carvey would think that his sight gags are funny. Brent Spiner completly upstages Carvey in the comedy department, he at least made me laugh... once. This movie is completly forgettable. It is a waste of time and money, and Carvey should be sentenced to public service for the psycological damage he's inflicted on all who've seen this movie.

review_title: The best part was the credits
review_detailed_main: This movie was horrible in almost every way. The acting was poor, and the characters were very annoying. The plot was almost nonexistant, and the writers relied on continuing about three jokes throughout the film which were not even funny to begin with. This is not a film I would recommend to any adult, however the three young children I was with enjoyed it. If your children want to see it, I would recommend hiring a babysitter to take them, because it is worth the twenty dollars you would spend on the babysitter not to expose yourself to such senseless tripe. In all honesty the best part of the film was the ending credits, which included funny outtake scenes.

review_title: one or two good lines, and that's about it
review_detailed_main: I saw the trailer for this movie, and thought it might be good. I liked Dana Carvey in some Saturday Night Live stuff, and particularly Wayne's World, but this movie didn't cut it. I think the key to this was that Dana Carvey was the writer for Master of Disguise. He acts well to well written material, but he's not much of a writer. Generally, the dialogue just got old and irritating really quickly, and was just not very funny. He really tended to overdo things that may have been funny for a little while, but they went on longer than they should.

review_title: Yeah, one of the worst movies ever
I disguised myself as a sleeping person while watching this movie

review_detailed_main: Very good comedy.Twisted and realy funny.:))You need to watch it.

Fine fine fine, ok... if you want to trash this movie go ahead. But I think the people who are trashing Master of Disguise went into the theater expecting latenight SNL humor that, if you were watching in the late 80's and early 90's, wasn't always kiddie material.

Master of Disguise is just about FUN - and in that it excels because the level of fun is for kids. I enjoyed the film, and still enjoy being cutely-irritating to my girlfriend by quoting the film, possibly because I'm incredibly immature - but also possibly because I'm dynamic enough to appreciate multiple levels of humor. Dana Carvey did a great job on this project and I would love to see him do more, but with the 25-35 audience in mind this time :)

review_title: Rating too low, film not as bad as rating
review_detailed_main:
I find this movie to be not as bad as the rating. Come to think of it, I enjoy it more than other mindless comedies like Zoolander, The Hot Chick, or the one that Aston Kutcher did (the title of which I forgot). With this one I did laugh once, in the cobra snake scene, and giggled a few times in several scenes. Of course there are lame moments here and there, but overall I think kids will like it.

Poor Spiner though, he only gets to do 1 joke, which is repeated way too many times.

Unfortunately, many people seem to really hate this movie and give it a rating of "1", skewing the total rating of this movie into the Bottom 100.

Normally, before I watch a movie I look it up here, and check director, actors to see if I have seen anything of their work. This time I didn't and it cost me 1,5 hours watching this crap. I had seen the trailer and it was all right, but the rest of the movie suffers from terrible direction and even worse editing. And I should have known. When I look at the films Perry Andelin Blake was involved with, Happy gilmore is the only one I would consider giving more than a 5/10. Co-writer Harris goldberg gave us the awful Deuce Bigalow.

conclusion: One of the worst movies I have ever seen, but because I had very few laughs I give it 2/10 instead of 1/10 (it wasn't as bad as blues brothers 2000)

I rented this movie hoping to get a good laugh. Well, that was a waste of good money.

In the movie, Dana Carvey a (hardly) lovable restaurant owner's son. When his parents are kidnapped by a dim-witted criminal mastermind, he learns his father is a master disguise artist. To save his parents, he'll have to become a "master of disguise."

There were a few funny scenes. Dana Carvey as Mr. Peru was kinda funny. I especially liked the parts where Dana Carvey is working with his grandpa. And I loved Carvey's "I'm going to be a master of disguise" dance.

But the rest of the movie was pointless. Most of Dana Carvey's characters, like Turtle Guy, and that little German nerd, rank among the most annoying characters I have ever seen in any movie. The supporting characters did little redeem Carvey's performance. If you're looking for a movie to rent on Friday nights, avoid this at all costs.

P.S.: What the heck was Jessica Simpson doing with the lunar lander?!

The Disguise was effective, there could have been a 5 minute sketch hiding in there but you would have been hard pressed to identify it. I find it hard to find anything good to stay about this film except possibly the pain didn't last very long. The out takes during the end credits were probably funnier than the film but that isn't saying much.

But not because it succeeds in the jokes that it tries to land or any attempts at humor that it tries to make. No, this movie is absolutely hysterical in just how unfunny it really is. I can't really put into words how I felt after watching this, but it was somewhere between throwing myself in front of a car, or finding and beating the nearest living thing into submission out of fear and anger. Don't watch this. Not even as a joke, like I did.

review_title: On a scale from 1-10, even 1 is too high!
review_detailed_main:
This movie is the worth pile of (insert the worst word you can think of). It is a direct insult to anyone who paid to see it, and even freeloaders will regret this.

I used to love Dana Carvey when he did Saturday Night Live, and this was my main motivation to see this film, but this seems to be the end of the man - if there is any fairness in the world. I feel directly hurt watching him insult me and other viewers with this Jim Carrey wannabe-crap (remark, I have no problem with Carrey, only the wannabe's!). This man had his own style but he sold out in the very worst way.

There is no point in this film, it's not funny, it's sad. All attempts fall to the ground and this movie should never have been!!!

On a scale from 1 to 10, 1 (which is awful) is still WAY too over rated! THIS IS, in short, THE SORT OF GARBAGE THAT ORDINARY GARBAGE WOULD FROWN UPON!

Sorry, Carvey! VERY sorry!
It's a good family movie to watch. Don't listen to the "disappointed" comments.

review_title: My nine-year-old loved it; what else do you want!
review_detailed_main: This is not "A Beautiful Mind" but with Carvey who would think it is. My nine-year-old grandson laughed almost uncontrolably all through the movie. I enjoyed that very much! Enjoyed the movie moderately. It's an on-target market for its intended audience and a lot of fun. Expectations are everything. I give it a 6.

review_title: Oh boy this film makes Mission impossible bad
Liked it as a kid, as an adult...
review_detailed_main: Despite what many critics say about it, I don't think this film was THAT bad, but still. Watching it in the theater with my cousin and little brother at the time, all everyone did was laugh. At school, me and my friends used to repeat the jokes and gags we remembered. In my eleven year old mind at the time, I actually thought we were laughing at the funny scenes. It was literally one of the funniest movies I watched. However, watching it again seven years later as a college freshman, I realized everyone, especially the adults were laughing at the over done gags, poor acting, and really childish style the film was made. Really the previews and TV spots showed all the funny parts and the rest of the film was just as bad as a straight to DVD Disney sequel. There were some scenes in there that I thought was to over the top like changing into a new costume in a matter of seconds even more annoying than the last. Jokes at the start of the film I realized on the second time watching it, were recycled through out the entire film like the villain's constant farts after his maniacal laughs. I didn't even laugh once like my eleven year old self almost died of in the theater. I really was surprised to read that Rotten Tomatoes rated this in the 100 worst movies of the decade, but I guess a lot can change in seven years regarding as to what some sees as funny and over the top. I would say don't even bother renting it, but I see no need because it's nowhere to be found.

review_title: Couldn't get far with this movie. That's how bad it it.
One of the worst movies I've ever seen.
review_detailed_main:
This movie was so unfunny it was painful to watch. Everything from the lame pop-culture references to the terrible forced accents was awful. This film practically gets on its knees and begs for laughs like none other I've seen, and this is compared to such classics like the police academy movies and any Adam Sandler movie. It's saddening to see a talented comedian like Dana Carvey stoop this low. Let any of your kids over the age of 5 watch this schlock and they'll probably slit your throat in your sleep.

Everything about it screams slapped together, All of his disguises appeared in the trailers, "Pistachio Disguisey". The impressions sounded like something the guy who gets drunk off his ass does at a party. The (thankfully) 80 minutes running time. Don't see this movie, ever. Even at a "crappy movie night" because there just isn't any entertainment value whatsoever.

review_title: Worst Movie that I have never seen!!!
review_detailed_main: This was without a doubt the worst movie that I have NEVER SEEN! I like Dana Carvey and think that he is very talented, but after watching the opening scene for about 5 minutes, I already had enough of his terrible accent....it was painful to the ears. After fast forwarding to the turtle scene, I stopped the movie and THREW IT OUT! I have to admit that I tend to enjoy stupid movies, but I couldn't even bare to give this one a chance :)

Ugh. The only thing keeping me from rating this a 1 instead of a 2 is that I know just how bad movies can be. This movie ellicited a few laughs from my girlfriend and I due to some bizarre dialogue, but the more obvious humor in the movie fell flat on its face. We mostly sat through the film in nervous silence. What were Adam Sandler and Dana Carvey thinking? The fact that this "Master of Disguise" only really changed into a handful of disguises was also pretty poor. Phil Hartman could do more with his voice than they did with this film. I feel sorry for those of you who will suffer through it.

When I first saw the previews, I thought that the movie would be good, but... no. I was really disappointed when I saw it. The movie turned out to be a family film that focused on entertaining younger viewers(Or, well tried). The movie would have been better as an independant movie on a kid's TV network. 70 minutes is pretty short and most of it is the characters rambling on about stuff. The plot is very weak and the characters aren't planned out well. Definately not worth the $6 you pay at the cinema. Wait untill it airs on cable TV so you can just turn off the TV if you get sick of it.
You know how sometimes SNL would have skits that are awkward and not funny, this film is one of them and it's 81 minutes too long. This movie is freaking awful!!! The Turtle scene!!? WTF!!!

review_title: Call me crazy, but I liked it...
review_detailed_main:
But before you chalk this up to being just the ramblings of a madman, a child or both, I would like to assure you that I am a 24 year old male with a broad sense of humor. I can't believe The Master of Disguise got such harsh reviews. It opened in Denmark nearly a year after it did in America so I had plenty of opportunities to read the bad reviews. But I decided to ignore them and to form my own opinion. I went to see it with my sister and I genuinely liked it. Word must have got around, because we were the only ones there, but on the other hand it was one of the smaller theaters in a multiplex cinema on a workday. Actually it added to the whole experience because we could laugh as loud as we wanted. And boy, did we laugh. There were so many funny scenes like The Turtle bit and the all too specific pop-up book, not to mention the slapping dummy. I especially enjoyed the references to other movies like when Grandfather Disguisey shows up Father Merrin style or when Pistachio shows up at Bowman's party disguised as Tony Montana. Another thing I liked was the cameos by for instance Bo Derek. I thought it was a great movie. The characters were both well cast and acted, furthermore I found that all the jokes were well carried out and none of them fell flat, not even Devlin Bowman's flatulence. It's nearly impossible to miss with a good fart joke.

What can I say? Sometimes you just can't rely on critics. I can't wait to see Malibu's Most Wanted. I know it too got some harsh reviews but I don't care. I've seen the trailer and it looks good to me. I'm going. Even if it doesn't open in the Danish theaters.

I thought I should comment as this movie is severely underrated. I just saw it on TV recently and found myself laughing quite a bit. It's clean comedy, so it's not as offensive or edgy as most, but the jokes are funny, and the performances are good. Brent Spiner is quite hilarious as the flatulant evil dude, and Dana Carvy is hilarious at ... well ... being Dana Carvy. I always liked Dana Carvy and always enjoy seeing his impersonations and comedy routines. I felt like they played it a little too safe though. I'd like to see him and Mike Meyers together again. Maybe Austin Powers vs the Master of Disguise or something where they can both play a lot of roles. Sure Austin Powers is much funnier than this, but it's for adults and is allowed be edgier so it's not exactly a fair comparison. I'd like to see Dana Carvy do something a bit edgier. But for now, this film is a humorous way to spend time with the family.

review_title: I WANTED to like this movie...
Adults will laugh, but it's for kids

review_detailed_main: My sister was watching this with a friend, and I decided to watch too. At first I simply assumed that I had missed something, but as it dragged on I only got more confused. By the end, I was at a loss for words. At first I thought that there had to be an explanation, but there was none. Only after careful thought did I realize I had just experienced a level of stupidity that I did not previously know existed. It was hyperstupidity; stupidity that was stupid in itself. The plot was nonexistent. SURE, you could write a summary the movie, but on closer examination you see that the sequence of events is only a bunch of fragments. A plot has unity. I rate this movie 1 out of 10, but only because it taught me a new concept.

After I saw Scooby Doo at the theater, I never thought I would again witness a movie that topped it for sheer idiocy, lousy acting, and utter lack of inspiration. Then I saw Master of Disguise. The only way I can properly describe the effect it had, is to say it was a Freddy Got Fingered-ish string of retarded skits. It was like an overly long home video. I can't dump on this movie enough. I don't need to, where my dumping leaves off, the movie dumps on itself like a baby ruins diapers. The script was idiotic. The character Pistachio is an annoying #$%# that Jar Jar Binks would be jealous of. This is one of the absolute worst movies of all time. DO NOT WATCH THIS MOVIE. DO NOT LET YOUR PET DOG WATCH THIS MOVIE. This review already is more in-depth than the movie's plot. Don't waste your time or money with this crud.

Actually, that might be a bit overstated, I'm not entirely sure the people behind this movie were really trying to make a good movie. This movie seems to me to be a textbook example of Rat Race Syndrome, wherein you get a whole bunch of A-List actors in an effort to make up for a plot which is at its essence crap. However, there's only one thing that keeps this from being such a movie: Good actors. Sure, Dana Carvey did a brilliant job with what was handed to him and probably deserves praise for his performance in this god-awful movie. Everyone else, though, came across simply terrible in their efforts, which, I would suspect, were minimal to begin with. As a result, there is the sad likelihood that this movie has ruined Dana Carvey's career. I haven't seen him resurface since this movie, though perhaps I am not looking hard enough. However, I would completely understand him not wanting to show his face anywhere after this extraordinarily terrible movie.

This over budgeted, juvenile piece of cinematic sewage, makes Such Turkeys as Rhinestone, Citizen kane. My friend's Five year old looked at me mid way through and even said, can we go home now?? UGGGGGHHHHH!!! What horrors will the Studios unleash upon us next??

review_title: Nearly as bad as you've heard
review_detailed_main:
Dana Carvey is an extremely talented individual, with a flair for voices and looks, the supporting cast all perfectly capable, and a rather impressive list of Celebrity Cameos, It took me a little while to work out why this movie is so bad.

It is one of those movies where you can identify each and every joke, but you don't laugh at a single one of them. Kids will miss much of the "humour" and probably a lot of the fast spoken dialogue will whoosh over their heads, Adults will of course realise that comedy moved beyond fart jokes and silly voices.

Its a shame that Carvey may end up being remembered for this, after such wonderful work on SNL and Waynes World. Lets hope he finds a better outlet some time soon...

I thought this movie was halarious. I think this movie was very well done. I was surprised that critics didn't like it. It was great. I laughed at least 19 times! I Love Dana Carvey's acting and I'll see almost anything that he's one of the main charachers in. 10 stars!

In this world today everyone is so cynical and serious. They need to lighten up and enjoy a silly movie from back in the day. I think it's funny and sure it can be silly, but that's the purpose of this film. I just wish all the other reviewers here would lighten up. It is a film filled with crude jokes at times, but it gives a lifetime of laughs with those you watch it with. It's great for the whole family to watch. It definitely will keep your attention and if you watching it again after years of having not seen it, all I can say is you won't be dissapointed. 10/10 fun movie that I quote still to this day.

review_title: stop taking this movie so seriously
review_detailed_main: i am sick of all you people who are saying this is the worst movie ever or that is not funny. ITS A FRIGGIN KIDS MOVIE!!! if your gonna take a movie like this that seriously u shouldn't watch comedies.. or any other movie for that matter. it was for kids, it makes kids laugh, so thats all that matters. we need more good kid shows like this. i agree it wasn't my favorite Dana Carvey movie but thats not the point. to all of you that say this is the worst movie ever, obviously you've never seen Ghost Lake or Gili. now those are movies that deserve bad criticsm. leave the kids movies alone. there not meant to win Oscars or any other award, they're just meant to entertain kids and people with an open mind, which this movie does successfully. if your gonna see this movie, i recommend that you have one or the other. just stop giving it such negative feedback. all it does is make you sound like an idiot for dissing a movie,or watching a movie for that matter, meant for eight year old's. And to all of you who honestly thought is was a movie for older people and thought it would have "adult humor" how damn stupid can you be. what in the previews or trailers made it sound adult, was it the slapping machine, the turtle scene, the meant-to-be-fake Italian accent, because all those things just scream "PG-13". dumbasses. this may seem a little harsh and rude, but from what i've read about this movie and the harsh criticism its been getting, you all deserve it.

review_title: An absolutely terrible movie. VHS by September.
review_detailed_main: Once again, proof that 5 minute Saturday Night Live skits can't be threaded together to create a satisfying 90 minute movie. This movie is dreadful. Even the resort to animal gags was terrible. Much of the funny stuff was in the outtakes at the end of the show. Really sad.

This movie counts on 5 year old children giggling to this broken spring of a film in order to make money. It's easily one of the cringiest movies I've seen in my life. Akward acting, very poor duologue, and script that sounds nearly possessed. Aside form that, the plot moves a bit smoothly at a calm rate, the villan isn't the worst thing I've ever seen, and, if you're alone when you watch it, you can actually laugh to the cringness of it. And at least it doesn't become offensive to the point of a PG13 rating. I watched this movie at a very young age, and I loved it. But at least I'm more responsible for this than I used to. So all in all, it's just plain bad.

Fortunately, I neither rented nor paid a dime to see this movie. A friend of mine who I actually like highly recommended it and lent it to me. I must say that I now evaluate everything she says and does in a different light. The whole plot is a series of impersonations and characters that Dana Carvey can easily handle, but this movie's funny points could have been a 3 minute stand-up routine at best. I only watched the whole thing to be able to discuss it with my friend. The highlights were the Robert Shaw bit and a very small amount of the Al Pacino bit. The first time Brent Spiner farted, maybe. But the Turtle Club scene and some of the dialog was so mindless that I refused to let my six year old watch the movie. It definitely belongs in the bottom 100 of all time.

Simply put, one of the worst movies I've ever seen (Hudson Hawk still tops my list.) I thought "Data" was more amusing than Dana, but only because I'm easily amused by fart jokes. The trailer that I saw for this movie is dishonest... there are scenes/dialogue in the trailer not shown in the movie.

Coming here and reading comments on movies usually gives me an idea if a movie will be good or not. But I did not do so for this movie because I knew that Dana Carvey would not disappoint. OK... from now on I research ALL movies before hitting the theatres.

This is half an idea jammed awkwardly into 2/3 of a film. It only runs 68 minutes, and runs out of steam long before that. I laughed slightly only twice, and that was during the 16 minute end credits filled with bloopers. Other than that and Miss Rodriguez, this is a waste of time. Lame jokes are half set up and then delivered almost as an after thought. Dana Carvey just doesn't have the star power to carry even a supporting role. It's a good thing he's backed up by such superstars as James Brolin and Bo Derek. It's about as funny as getting poked in the eye. As memorable as a toothache. Less interesting than your last attack of diarrhea. Still, I'd have to say I was more entertained than I was by Attack of the Clowns, not that that's such a hard thing to accomplish. RATING: 3 out of 10.

review_title: Awesome as a kid, terrible as a teenager
review_detailed_main:
When i was about 10 years old, this was one of my favourite films. I thought it was hilarious! Now being 17, I can now see how bad this movie actually was. Acting is pretty lame, fart jokes are over-used, all the elements of a bad movie. Pop culture references don't give this film any favors.

What impresses me most about the film is Dana Carvey. His impersonations are above average, and save this film from being horrible.

Kids will love this, adults may get a chuckle from the impersonations, but it won't please critics.

review_title: Only film I couldn't endure to finish, is horrible. Oh the humanity!
review_detailed_main: As I wrote this review, I realized I found my self in difficulty to find the correct words to describe how bad this movie is. As anyone else, I have favourite genres of film and there are of course some which I don't enjoy as much, some that I honestly don't like or appreciate, but in the end, I had always been able to watch any film from beginning to end, until I watch this film, I had to eject the DVD and stop watching, I was painful to endure, and ever since, I have been able to watch any film. This film was really a disappointing, considering how much enjoyed Dana Carvey's performances on SNL and in Wayne's World. The only advice that I can give to anyone, is to stay away from this film, as far away as one would try to stay away from Ebola.

I knew from the trailers that this movie was a disaster. This is why I did not go see it at a theatre. I watched it on video solely for the purpose of supporting Dana Carvey. Dana was brilliant on SNL. I loved the impressions he pulled off. He is very talented. Unfortunately he made a poor choice with this movie. I agree with others who have asked why Carvey needed to make a kid's movie.

Nothing makes sense in this movie. Why does Dana's character have a heavy Italian accent if he was raised in the U.S.A.? None of the characters are likeable. Dana's character seemed to be retarded.

The fart jokes were plain stupid. How that got in the final product I do not know. All the actors are known names and people I like but this script and production had them all treading in toilet water.

I hope this movie does not end Dana's movie career. I see Dana making a come back as a vibrant character actor. He will not make it as a lead actor. Also it would be great if Dana could come back to TV comedy with the right vehicle.
Underappreciated, this movie was my childhood, with bunch of main characters that I truly enjoyed. Don't read these bad reviews

review_title: Definitely a film made for small children.
review_detailed_main:
Being a huge fan of Dana Carvey, I just had to go out and see this movie. I wasn't terribly impressed with the trailers, but I just had to see this to support Dana nonetheless.

The film is most definitely a kids movie. The story is very silly and VERY bizarre at times. Overall though, Dana Carvey does a fine job. Some of the humor is right on, and just hilarious, but at other times it really isn't that funny (but maybe it is to a kid, I don't know, I'm not a kid). Some of the jokes struck me as very odd, here's an example: There's a scene where Dana Carvey is blatantly parodying Al Pacino in "Scarface". It's actually quite a funny scene, and he does it quite well, but I can't imagine ANY kids of today have seen "Scarface", and I hope they haven't. I myself just recently saw the film. So, jokes like that really struck me as odd.

All the cast members did a fine job. Dana Carvey does what he does, and does it quite well. I think Jennifer Esposito is reason enough to sit through this movie. She looks absolutely fantastic in this film! The instant her face is shown on the screen, my jaw hit the floor, she has NEVER looked better! I was happy to see Brent Spiner (aka Data of Star Trek) in the film. I've always liked his acting, and he did a fine job in this film. One other notable thing is the slew of cameo's in this film. I won't mention any of them though, I wouldn't want to take away the surprise.

If you like silly children's movies or just like Dana Carvey or any of the other cast members, then you should go ahead and check this out. If you didn't like what you saw in the trailers, I don't think there is any way you are going to like the film. Anyhow, I hope you enjoy the film. Thanks for reading,

-Chris

review_title: Advertisements are the ONLY highlights... get back in your turtle shell.
review_detailed_main:
Mindless drivel comes to mind... insult to one's intelligence is another, but I think I will stick with the word 'boring' to describe Master of Disguise.

A friend rented Kung Pow: Enter the Fist a few months back and I thought of that as the worst movie I had seen next to Star Trek V: The Final Frontier... well Master of Disguise takes the cake, or turtle shell in this case. The commercials gave the impression of a very witty and funny Dana Carvey movie that was released about the same time as his friend Mike Meyer's movie, Goldmember. The problem is, the commercials WERE the movie. Any, and all funny material presented in the movie were contained in the 45 second spot that ran on TV. That means 79 minutes and 15 seconds of the movie were a complete waste of time.

So much more could have been done with the premise of a 'Master of Disguise', but instead they made the movie into a borefest of awful acting, horrible cliches, and a running fart scene that popped up every time the villain, played by Star Trek's Brent Spiner, laughed and lost control of his bowels.

If you wish to be entertained, I would recommend you watch Tombstone, Saving Private Ryan, or maybe endless re-runs of Lost in Space. To quote Dr. Smith from Lost in Space... "Oh the pain... oh the pain!" Master of Disguise rates a perfect score of ZERO in my book.

review_title: A rib tickler for the goof troops!

review_detailed_main: Dana Carvey is talented, that's a given. But he cannot seem to get a really decent cinematic vehicle to display this talent - he had his best chance in The Road to Wellville, where he got to create an actual 3-dimensional character. In Master of Disguise, he plays the ridiculously-named Pistachio Disguisey (the name alone should give you some idea of how lame this film is). He talks with a silly yet endearing Italian accent, and he puts on lots of disguises in his quest to save his parents, who have been kidnapped by a bad and rotten evil-doer who wants his father to use his disguise mastery to do bad and rotten evil things, blah blah blah. What else do you need to know? Get some popcorn and make the best of it. It's still Dana Carvey in that turtle suit, after all.

It is a mystery to why I bothered even watching this film because I knew perfectly well that any film shown at 3 o'clock is not going to be remotely entertaining. For a lack of anything better to do (this has to be the only reason for anyone watching it), I sat down and tried to take in this tripe.

First of all, it is obvious that it is trying too hard to be funny and is blatantly copying features of respectable films e.g. SHREK and THE EXORCIST. Punchlines are too obvious, these half-baked jokes are unbearable and you wonder if the producers even bothered thinking about how the plot works. Also, someone in the production is totally obsessed with slapping people.

I feel pity on the main character for being so embarrassing. He deserves better! Even though I have been only exposed to mostly decent films, this has to be one of the worst movies of all time.
Worst Movie Ever. Don't even bother wasting your money on this one. Dana Carvy should be ashamed of himself for this worthless piece of trash. After 15 minutes I wanted to leave the theater. 1/10

I saw the turtle scene before watching the full movie. I found it unbearably annoying, and I thought it must be famous for being the worst scene. Surely the rest of the movie can't be as bad as that, right?

No, it is. The rest of the movie is just as bad as the turtle scene, in fact, some of it is even worse.

review_title: No wonder he didn't make any other movies after this one...
It pains me to say this, but ...
review_detailed_main:
It really pains me to say this, but this movie was dreadful. I'm a huge Carvey fan, but I came away from this one very disappointed. Has he lost his touch? I don't think so, but I'm not going to use this movie as evidence to back up my point.

This movie was so disjointed, and many of the "characters" were flat-out contrived and stupid. Carvey's strengths aren't the contrived characters, but his impersonations of real people (could he have done more George W. Bush and less of the turtle?). Other than Carvey, the only redeeming quality for this piece of junk was the fact that it was so short.

Four stars out of ten, but two of them are just for Carvey.

What a horrible movie! Dana Carvey is repulsive, revolting and self-serving. Who in Gods name allowed him to go ahead and produce such utter crap. Not even my partners seven year old brother laughed. Im not even going to bother explaining why - just trust me and avoid at all costs.

We saw this in the theater upon release. It was panned then just as it is now (by some, not all). Our family have always loved it and watch it/quote it regularly. That includes our younger children that were born after the movie was released.

I get annoyed that it is frequently compared to Austin Powers when they are clearly aimed at different audiences, with the latter mainly relying on overly crude/lazy humor. Master of Disguise has an ongoing flatus joke that is uniquely funny because of the timing and that it is a parody of when the bad guy laughs. The movie has great production design, fun characters and visuals. The grouchy reviewers of this movies are not turtley enough for the Turtle Club.

This movie is aimed at kids but I think many adults can get a kick out of it too. Dana Carvey is always funny on TV or on the big-screen, and it was a treat to see some new material from him. This film is full of good messages and has a fantasy element to go along with great comedy. The bonus footage during the credits is very funny. I can't wait to see what comes next from the comedic mind of Dana Carvey.

This is one of the worst movies I have seen in years, if not ever. It is sad that such a good comedian as Dana Carvey should have made this movie. I knew we were in trouble when his father in the movie came out and it was James Brolin, supposedly an Italian! And, when "Data" from Star Trek's most important role in the movie was to fart. Avoid this movie like the plague. The trailer made it seem funny, but the trailer contained EVERY funny joke from the movie, and somehow the jokes seemed a lot less funny in context. This is a real turkey.

review_title: If you hate Dana Carvey, you'll love this movie
Not all SNL graduates get a degree in film.
review_detailed_main:
As much as I may have liked Dana Carvey on SNL, this movie is a very poor display of his talent. Dana has been dealt some bad hands lately with his smart comedy show being prematurely cancelled, his heart surgery mishap, and being out of the public spotlight for so long. His other SNL friends are making money, so why not him too?

The movie was just an excuse to dress up and act silly, and the characters are not some of his better ones. Much of the jokes were references to pop culture, a cheap trick that will date the movie very soon. The only laughs from the audience were the cheaply low reoccurring fart jokes. The plot was incoherent and it jumped around too much the editor must have been drunk. The outtakes and gags while the credits were rolling would make even Jackie Chan woozy.

On a positive note, this movie was very clean. There were a few minor PG jokes, but this movie could be shown unedited on TV. In an age where crude jokes are the norm to get a laugh, this movie, for the most part, avoided it. Kids might find it amusing, but that's about it. I so wanted him to be funny, but too bad the movie is just...well...bad.

review_title: I feel dumber for having seen this movie.
review_detailed_main: This is easily one of the top 5 worst movies of all time. I wish I could have those precious minutes of my life back. I think "The Onion" said it best, "DVD released with 83 minutes of previously unseen movie", and the movie was only 80 minutes long!

review_title: Perhaps the worst movie I've seen in five years
review_detailed_main:
Some comedies work, and others don't. This one doesn't. You can just see Dana Carvey sitting around a table with some prospective producer, "Okay, I'll be this guy, a member of the Disguisey family, and we're masters of disguise. My parents get kidnapped, and I have to use my new found disguising powers to get them free. There will be a good looking female asistant, of course, and hilarious disguises and scenes. You'll love it." What I can't visualize, is a producer saying, "Yes! What a great idea!"

Perhaps the emptiness of the comedy in this movie can be summarized by the fact that the biggest laugh they get, and one the movie goes back to perhaps ten times, is flatulence. Farting. Wow. Really funny. Maybe I am unable to appreciate that kind of comedy any more, but even my eleven year old didn't laugh at that, or anything else. I didn't even crack a smile. Not once. Not for the entire movie.

As to the other review that says this movie contains deep social commentary and references to other movies, sure, there are some echoes of other films, but it is meaningless and adds nothing. I've laughed harder at beer commercials than at this movie. Do yourself a favor. Save your money.

I saw this movie through a drive way, it was like a drive through movie and I saw it, and it was terrible movie and the part was ok, but while I was watching the whole thing. It was so terrible of how he plays the guy and the wrost part he said: It might work, in a dumb way. I really hated this movie and I give it a thumb down, and feel free to respond and talk to you soon everyone!!!

Horrible movie, not even funny. Ended up getting our money back and leaving. The kids around us laughed a little bit, but after 20 minutes or so, even they grew bored and got up. Best parts of the film were in the trailers.

review_title: I wanted to spoon out my eyes...
review_detailed_main: As a loyal Garth fan, I walked in expecting something at the very least, entertaining. I expected silly, but not inane. Nothing was funny or entertaining. Nothing was amusing. All was simply stupid. I didn't laugh ONCE. Why famous stars would cameo in this drivel is beyond me. I think less of Governor Ventura and Michael Johnson now for their participation. LESS than 1 out of 10.

I went to the theater to see this movie and I regret it. It was a waste of money. There were some funny parts but not many. Though I do think it would be funny for little kids or stupid teenagers.
