This movie was my last hope for a good comedy. I wouldn't recommend this movie to anyone that I like, but maybe someone I hate.

review_title: It's worth at least a 6 , Personally i really enjoyed the impressions
review_detailed_main: This is a great movie for the whole family , If you can appreciate toilet humour and great impressions for what they are instead of looking for a deep meaningful comedy this is the movie for you, Still holds up after watching it a couple times over the years. Deserves less hate , there are a lot worse movies out there

review_title: Not that bad, BUT DANA CARVEY?
review_detailed_main:
Usually I like to write a very constructive review that analyzes the good and bad of any movie. But I just can't.

It's not because this movie was that bad. In fact, when I was younger I actually enjoyed it. While it is nothing good, it isn't bad either. In fact, at least it's entertaining for a child.

It's just the fact that the protagonist is played by Dana Carvey... I didn't know who he was when I was a kid, but I do now and it hurts seeing him reduced to nothing.

It really hurts... It hurts so bad it ruins the film entirely, as well as my mood when I think about it. If you're reading this and don't know who he is, I beg you to check out his SNL work. He is an amazing comedian.

Overall, this film is nothing horrendous. It doesn't have much of a message, the comedy can only be enjoyed by small children, and it's quite forgettable. But it's harmless entertainment for children. Adults and teens will want to sit this one out... especially if they know who Dana Carvey is.

Without question the worst movie I have ever seen. Had the projector broke even 10 minutes before the end, it would have spared me another agonizing 10 minutes, as I could have cared less how the movie ended. Annoying characters, inane plot, and the scene in the Turtle Club made me want to vomit. This is truly a comedy without a single funny moment. The only reason to stay and watch even one moment of this bomb is the very beautiful Jennifer Esposito. I cannot say enough bad things about this movie. I have however recommeded this movie to several people; my ex-wife, mother-in-law, and other people I felt needed to be punished. You have been warned!!!

( Please note that this review was not written by me, the actual imbetterthanu, it was written by my little sister.) This was the worst movie I've ever seen. It wasn't funny at all, it was just plain stupid. Whoever made this movie probably smells funny, and they are also very stupid. Now you know how i think of the movie.

review_title: Is there a rewind on me buying this movie?
review_detailed_main:
I really, really wanted to like this movie. I love Dana Carvey (from SNL) and Brent Spiner (from Star Trek: TNG).

Unfortunately, there are literally NO laugh out loud moments in this movie. The only chuckles even, were generated when Brent Spiner's character laughed maniacally and then got cut off by his uncontrollable gas. Otherwise, the few smiles just didn't cut it.

I bought this, but do yourself a favour and don't even rent it. Get Wayne's World, or Moving, or some other comedy where Dana Carvey is actually funny.

Phew.

This was easily the worst movie I have ever had to sit through.

I was felt very embarrassed for Carey. I was so looking forward to it as I was really likes his nerdish and shy character in the waynes world movies.

Not only what was he thinking but also what was he doing in half of the scenes? Did he do half of them himself or did the director also go to sleep with his performance and not yell cut ? ? ?

PLEASE LET ME FORGET THIS QUICKLY.

There are good films and there are bad films. The Master of Disguise is a bad film. Period. Dana Carvey stars as Pistachio Disguisey, an Italian waiter who has a strange and uncontrollable addiction to mimicking his customers. When his mother (Eddie McClurg) and father (James Brolin) are kidnapped by a criminal mastermind (Brent Spiner), Pistachio learns with the help of his grandfather (Harold Gould) that he has inherited a magical power that allows him to disguise himself as anyone in the world, which he must use to save his parents.

I don't know what Dana Carvey was thinking when he decided to take part in this film. I believe that it was a waste of his great acting abilities and this has probably ruined his career (in fact, according to his IMDb page he hasn't been in anything since this.) My main problem with this film are the childish, unfunny jokes. There just aren't any laugh-out-loud parts of the film that I can remember. For example, there is a running joke in which Spiner's character has uncontrollable flatulence and it fails terribly to gain a laugh.

I think that they had a good plot line in their hands, but it got lost in the terrible writing. This could have been a classic, fun family film that both parents and children could enjoy and could have made Dana Carvey very well known and more of a household name. It's a shame that this film was so bad because Dana Carvey has so much talent.

The only good thing I can come up with about The Master Of Disguise is that kids will love it. But, I have to say that kids are pretty god damn stupid.

With bad jokes and childish humour, The Master Of Disguise is a terrible film. I give it 3/10.

review_title: A career killer disguised as an unfunny comedy.
review_detailed_main: Dana Carvey is a talented comedian that has previously worked on a lot of funny shows and movies like "Wayne's world" and "Saturday Night Live". However, all this comedic talent seems to have faded away while he was writing and starring in this particular movie based on the "Saturday Night Live" sketch of the same name. Sadly, what works as a five minute sketch does not work as an eighty minute long movie. The movie is unfunny beyond belief, but it can be entertaining in a guilty pleasure kind of way as long as you turn your brain off before you start watching.

review_title: Absolutely stinko - abysmal waste of a great comedian's talent
review_detailed_main: This movie is simply unwatchable. A word of advice for those who haven't seen "The Master of Disguise": for those of you - like me - who loved Dana Carvey's impressions and comedy on SNL, remember him that way. I thought he was in the top 5 SNL cast members ever, and it was always a mystery to me why Adam Sandler & Chris Rock (fair-to-middling SNL alumni IMO) became stars while some of the true comedic geniuses like Phil Hartman and Dana Carvey didn't get top roles. In Mr. Carvey's case, the mistake of being in this film show that making good choices is of paramount importance to those aspiring to move on to the big screen. The movie is never funny and isn't even "bad" good. It just stinks. He plays a character named "Pistachio Disguisey". COME ON - my 5-year-old nephew could come up with a wittier name, and believe me, he wouldn't laugh at even the most infantile jokes in this flick. I defy any adult to even crack a smile. If you do, you must be on acid. AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!

Gave this 4/10...because I just gave "Once upon in Mexico" a 3...and it wasn't much better...

Overall, this movie had some semi-funny parts, but overall it was just kinda dumb...

I know there are parts that are super cheesy but all around this movie makes me laugh constantly even if it's when it's not funny. I honestly love this movie and I watch it constantly. They definitely could have done without the Declan Bowman farting but it still makes me giggle. There's just a certain innocence in this movie that when you watch it you feel happy. I constantly see all these people complaining about how bad the movie is. Those people honestly must not like any happy Madison movie because they all have the same dry humor that most people go crazy for but as soon as this movie comes out it's bad to have this dry humor. I honestly love this movie and I gave it a 10.

review_title: So ... I don't think it's "supposed" to be all that good
review_detailed_main:
While this isn't an apex comedy that will go down in history as a classic - many years later my family and I still quite parts of the movie and laugh.

Not sure if we are laughing with it or at it - but we're laughing.

It's over-the-top ridiculous. There are some cringe moments - that somehow get into your head.

So I rated it a little higher - just to draw attention to it a bit :)

Imagine the worst SNL skit that just won't die. Not the slightest bit funny. Really! Just dumb. Not funny dumb, just dumb. The gags don't work the jokes don't match the setups and dana carvy is an idiot. I really regret that brint spiner allowed himself to be associated with ths junk. Especially the really bad fart joke.

review_title: The truly sad thing about it is...

review_detailed_main:
I don't think I'm capable of expressing just how truly awful this film was. It's a total mystery to me as to how it was ever made.

The storyline was inane, ludicrous and just plain weak. After the first 20 minutes or so, I thought that the 'set up' was talking way too long, but then nothing followed it! I like Dana Carvey, and would have liked to have liked this film, but it wasn't possible - it had no redeeming qualities whatsoever (with the possible exception of Jennifer Esposito).

I'm trying to recall one moment when I laughed and am singularly failing. I generally like silly humour, but there was nothing here that was remotely risable.

The impressions were good (particularly the Al Pacino), but some were pointless. What the heck was that turtle thing all about? How did the writers and producers ever contemplate for one moment that there was going to be nothing amusing about a man in a turtle suit.

Really, really terrible. Maybe Dana can't carry a film on this own - perhaps teaming up with Adam Sandler (executive producer on this travesty) for a future venture may be the best he can hope for.

review_title: One of the worst movies ever made ever
I can't believe this was released!
review_detailed_main:
This is the weakest film I have seen for a long time. All of the 'set-piece' jokes such as the Turtle guy completely fell flat. I watched this at my friend's house with a few others and the only funny things we were seeing were each other's reactions to this shoddy film. Even at just £2.95 on DVD (less than $5 for you American readers) to buy this was a waste of money. The best part of the DVD was the deleted scenes, namely the Mayor Maynot scene which despite being the funniest scene that was filmed by an absolute mile, still managed to end up on the cutting room floor.

I dread to think what was going through the heads of the producers when they were making this. Surely they must have realised that it was complete crap before they even got the cameras out. Or maybe not as on the DVD commentary they talk about the film like it's a masterpiece. I'm not going to say this is the worst film ever, because it isn't, but it isn't far off either.

Perhaps Dana Carvey should have disguised his name as well as I can't see a career recovery after this blunder.

review_title: "Master of Disguise" disguised humor too well
review_detailed_main: When I saw that Dana Carvey was in "The Master of Disguise," I just had to see it. He is one of my favorite comics, and I thought he did a fabulous job as Garth in "Wayne's World". But when I finally saw this movie, I couldn't stand it. It was terrible. Absolutely and completely terrible. There were way too many things overdone in this movie. The running "gas" gag was funny the first time, but after that it became predictable and in poor taste. Even the ending was too long. It was also hard to watch Brent Spiner in the role as Devlin Bowman, because he is so much better than that (plus it's hard to see him portray anyone but Commander Data in the Star Trek series). Don't waste your money folks.

I watched it with a 9 yo. I had thought one of us would laugh @ some point with Dana Carvey writing and staring in it. I was wrong. Movies that are this expensive to make are almost painful to me.

Things I liked: Jennifer Esposito has some screen presence - The little ball and the font in the opening credits - Scareface dance sequence

Things I had difficulty with: Brent Spiner can't do fart jokes to save his life - All the impersonations were just off - Pacing of the action - Accents.

review_title: Good candidate for the worst movie ever
review_detailed_main: Even horrible movies such as Howard the Duck, Caddyshack 2, and Nothing But Trouble at least are so bad that they are funny just for being so bad. This movie is just plain bad. Dana Carvey is so much better than this, a real shame.

review_title: just another review of this lousy flat waste of time
review_detailed_main:
I didn't expect much from this movie - based on the reviews and what I got was even less than I expected.

As like most of the other stuff that Adam Sandler has his hands on, or any connection with whatsoever - this is dismal, shoddy and embarrassing on all levels - and almost no coherent redeeming value.

Do yourself a favour and avoid this one as well. It's a failure from the first 2 minutes - because there is no plot, the characters are poorly created, the casting is totally off and there is little if anything else to keep you amused or entertained.

Like most of the other reviewers of this movie, I too will warn you - and it's your responsibility if you don't take it.

This is beyond a waste of time.

Kids absolutely loved it. Despite my misgivings this one ended up being one of my all time favourite funny family movies.

The critics, as usual are completely out of touch of what was special about this movie.

I know good movies.

This is one, for the young family.

review_title: This has become one of my guilty pleasures!
review_detailed_main:
Relax - enjoy this film. It isn't sophisticated, it isn't art, but everyone involved goes for it full speed, and it is really pretty funny. You either get the joke or you don't, but it isn't the horrible train wreck that some are making it out to be, one of the "third worst comedies of all time", as has been quoted. And contrary to some other reviews, Dana Carvey does spend a good amount of time in disguise throughout the film. My particular favorites are the Turtle Man and Gammy Num-Nums.

I will admit that some of the disguises will go over the young one's heads, but the adults will get it and the kids will still laugh.

This film is best described as being many of the things you never thought someone would have the guts to do - and then did. I can't wait for my son to get a little older so I can show this to him.

We went to the drive in last night to see this. Which Signs was playing on the other screen and me and the wife would have liked to switch but the boys 7 and 5 would not have got that one. I like Dana Carvey movies and I like a lot of the stuff the kids watch. I can even handle sponge Bob but this was just stupid even more stupid then Sponge Bob Square pants.

Look, I'm all for silly movies and I dug the Austin Powers trilogy, but this was just sad. Dana Carvey plays a 23 year old when we know he's 47 at the time (see the problem there?). Most of his dialogue is saying something stupid, and attempting to make us laugh because the movie seems to be under the misconception that random sight gags are funny. The only reason it worked in Austin Powers is because they were smartly done. Here most of them are so hammy you can't enjoy them. On a worse note we have James Brolin as the father and Edie McClurg as the mother. It seems like their only purpose is to have two big names. Brolin's performance is so over the top it's embarrassing and McClurg is well... McClurg, she can only do so much. Spiner as Devlin Bowman is a fart happy crazy man who was put in jail by Brolin's guy. And I do mean fart happy. He does it as comedic relief expecting we'll think the joke is funny if done enough. Fart jokes really just aren't funny. So if you want a smarter movie, scrap this and rent the Austin Powers trilogy.

review_title: Okay for young kids, boring for adults
review_detailed_main: My 7 year old laughed a lot, especially at the running fart joke (which I laughed at too, must admit). But there is really little here to interest anyone older than that. Carvey's disguises are great, but that's about all there is to this movie. His character is too silly to believe, there is a kid in a superfluous role, the usual babe for love interest, and a lot of general silliness around a wafer thin plot. It's safe for kids if they really want to see it, best to wait for video and save your money.

The script is bad and the jokes and slapstick don't work, but the worst part of this movie is the truly annoying character voice that Dana's character uses throughout the movie. It was painful to sit through.

The only mildly redeeming aspect was the endless stream of short comedy bites following the credits. They went on for so long and were almost as painful as the movie that my wife and I had to laugh. The movie just wouldn't end.

As bad as bad can be. Simply amazing how terrible this movie was... I am even ashamed to say that I saw it for free. True, I expected it to be "bad," but it surpasses this characterization beyond any movie I think that I have ever seen. The purest of pure dungus... Baffling.... Utter spunk.

review_title: People this is supposed to be a kids movie only.
review_detailed_main: All people think this movies was made for adults. People this is a movie made for kids it's a children's fantasy movie. It's not meant for grown ups but people rate it low cause they think it's made for grown ups. All people understand this is a movie made for only children young kids and older kids only. I give it a ten rating for a kids movie.

Pistachio's accent was irritating. Good impersonations: turtle man, 'W' Bush and Scarface character. I found a chuckle when Pistachio started dancing and flipping around the dance stage. My, how 'Data' ,Star Trek fame, has fallen! Would have been nice if Pistachio could have played a few more unique characters. Adam Sandler produced this movie?!?

Anyone who says this is bad doesn't know their movies,as someone with European descent I see the greatness of this movie! As with the movie toys it has a childlike feel,and Dana carvey is pretty funny! It reminds me of my childhood,as I saw this as a kid and laughed! Check this movie out!

review_title: Car Crash Comedy - Go see it! :-)
It takes a few viewings to appreciate.
review_detailed_main:
The production of this movie is pretty weak. It's disjointed and doesn't flow very well. I have to admit, after the first time seeing it I thought it was awful, but my 8 year old daughter and 4 year old son have it on tape and think it's hilarious. So I watched it with them again and after seeing it for the second time I remembered some really funny characters Dana Carvey does. The third time I watched it I found it to be extremely funny. It definitely grows on you.

One of the reviews I read here said that the characters Dana does aren't funny, but they couldn't be further from the truth. He does a character based on Tony Montana from Scarface that is hilarious! He also does a character named Gammy Numnums, which is an older snobby woman and is one of the funniest characters in the movie. The problem is that he does so many characters that none of them last long enough. His turtle-man character is really funny and gets funnier the more you see it.

Dana Carvey is an absolute brilliant comedian and this movie SHOULD HAVE been his gateway to super stardom (i.e. Jim Carrey). Unfortunately the movie really isn't very good and it shows upon first view. But give it a chance and watch it with you kids and I bet you'll be pleasantly surprised at how much you like it and want to watch it again.

I cant believe all the bad reviews and hate on Dana Carvey we think it was a very good movie and funny me and my kids still watch this movie matter of fact we watching it now while we put out this review. We enjoy every time we watch it and laugh.

"The Master of Disguise" is the latest movie to star Dan Carvey. In it, he takes on the role of Pistachio Disguisey, a human chameleon who takes on many roles. I found "Master of Disguise" silly, but somewhat enjoyable. Some of the movie references were well done, but on the whole, most adults would not care for this movie. Dana Carvey is a talented person, but he really deserved better than this!

review_title: This is a great film for the whole family
review_detailed_main: Okay, here's the thing. If you want a movie to enjoy with the whole family, this is it. My four-year-old son laughs and laughs along with the rest of us at the silliness of it all. Dana is great, all his disguises are funny, and it is neat to watch him do so many in one film. Brent Spinner is really a gas as the villain. The love interest in the film is good too. The film is worth watching many times. And watch for a reference to a scene in Ace Ventura two. Ace, says, let me introduce you to my little friend". There is no foul language. Furthermore, the cinematography is brilliant. The sound engineering is impeccable, especially the Brent Spinner sound effects. I highly recommend this film.

review_title: If you don't get the jokes in this movie...check your
Great Film For The Correct Audience - 8 year old boys
review_detailed_main:
This is the perfect film for an eight year old boy. It's a little crude, but not overly so. It has some physical humor and sight gags that almost everybody will find amusing. It is a just a little over 80 minutes long, another plus. It's not like you are investing "Lawrence of Arabia" like time into this. It has some mild comic violence, think Three Stooges for level of violence and then crank it back a little bit.

This movie suffers from what several movies made by refugees from Saturday Night Live have suffered from - it is incredibly difficult to make a full length motion picture out of a three minute skit. Dana Carvey does over the top caricatures familiar to anyone who watched SNL when Carvey was in the cast.

I watched this film several years ago and thought it was pretty dumb. I watched it again with my eight year old grandson and his appreciation of it made me rethink my opinion a bit. It is not a "date night" film, for sure, but if you are a babysitter of boys 6-10 years old this will hold their attention and make them laugh.

review_title: EXCELLENT Movie Apparently Disguised By Bad Reviews!
review_detailed_main: I have to say first and foremost that in a world where more and more, movies are getting darker and darker, like its a competition to see who can make the goriest, most disgusting movie - or it's a remake, it was a breath of fresh air to stumble upon Master of Disguise on Tubi!!! I've been meaning to watch this movie for YEARS, due to my LOVE of Dana Carvey, but EVERY TIME I reach out for it, I would put it back down, remembering the awful reviews! But I'm telling you here and now that those reviews are WRONG! This movie had me laughing, rooting for Pistachio to get his happy ending, and angry at DATA from Star Trek TNG, which I couldn't believe was possible, ESPECIALLY with those GORGEOUS blue eyes of his! But I digress, this movie tells the story of a inexperienced, socially awkward man, working as a waiter in his parents Italian restaurant, and he's bullied by about everyone in the world, except his Papa, even when Pistachio has one of his "episodes" and fades out and starts channeling a customer's voice and mannerisms, his Papa sees what's going on and tells the customer he's not welcome there, and about a dozen diners leave, but his Papa tells him how special he is, and how proud of him he is! At THAT moment, I fell in LOVE with this movie, became personally involved, and without giving away plot details, Pistachio ended up with a MAJOR crisis on his hands, and I just couldn't even pause it to go to the bathroom, I was too personally invested! This is a fun, funny, enjoyable movie from start to finish!!! The ONLY reason it didn't get a 10 was because the script had some issues I didn't care for, the grandfather's "help" bordered on abusive and bullying at times, and everyone's seen the "turtle" suit art the turtle club because it was on all the commercials, butt in the actual movie, it bordered on RIDICULOUS! He wouldn't shut up to talk to anyone, he just kept saying "turtle" and related things... he was sabotaging himself! ANYONE would have seen through that miles away!!! I still LOVED the movie, it was REALLY a feel good movie!!!
Great for kids and family. Not sure why the scores are so low :-(

This movie packs it all....drama, laughter, cabooses, Italian food, the cuteness, and a big wiener and some tiny nuts. If your wife loves this movie and you hate it just wait until she takes your phone to do a review on IMDB. The trajectory of my life was forever changed the first time I saw this movie. I feel free,happy and turtely enough for turtle club I may ever stumble upon. If you're looking for the peak of all cinema look no further than this masterpiece. You will not be disappointed. It'll make you laugh until you fart, but you will never be prepared for it. So go ahead, add just a little bit of luminol and jump start your evening by popping this bad boy into your vcr.

review_title: Not Perfect but consider it for what it is.
review_detailed_main:
Great family movie. A bit slow at points when you're older but it has enough funny moments to keep your interest.

Lot of Scrooge types reviewing this. I'd like to see them make a comedy. ;)

review_title: Have loved this movie since elementary school!!!
review_detailed_main: I literally created an imdb account JUST to post a review of this movie because I love it SO much and it gets such bad reviews. I also have 4+ other friends who adore this movie to no end!! Yes, it is VERY silly and VERY stupid, that is the entire point. It is definitely suited for young young ages like elementary school, but, as I have learned, once you thoroughly enjoy this movie you never stop loving it. I'm now 17 and rewatched it with my friend, and we both had lots of laughs!! The only thing I could say that's slightly negative about this movie is that you have to have a very specific type of humor to be an adult and really appreciate it. For example, if I saw this movie for the first time when im 20, it would not be too impactful the way it has been since I first saw it when I was younger (and the fart joke becomes a little overdone, but kids seriously LOVE it when jokes are repeated often since they have goldfish-attention-spans!). As a kids movie, this movie is 100% my favourite from my childhood! And since I have the type of humor that this movie consistently serves, it is one of my favorites still today.

_Master_of_Disguise_ is a niche market movie made and designed by Saturday Night Live folks of today or recent yesteryear. It stars Dana Carvey and also has SNL Adam Sandler in it and he produced it. But, the movie under credits the other stars of the film and fails to mention in its ads the cameos in it that might bring in other niche audiences other than the SNL audience. Brent Spiner plays the villain, Devlin Bowman, and this is one of his bigger non-Star Trek roles. He seemed to be having a lot of fun in the movie. He gives the character the relish and the glee he gives Lore and some other characters he has also played in the past, but in some ways, it is a new character, but I do see some common denominators between this character and one or more characters he has played in the past. The other actors and people in the film who were playing themselves, seemed to be having some fun with it also. It is good to watch a movie where one or more actors/actresses really seems to be enjoying what they're doing. That often seems to be the case with Mr. Spiner. He never leaves his heart behind, but always includes it in any given role. That's one thing that makes Mr. Spiner different from a lot of other actors - he acts with his heart and not just with his head. One catch in the movie is the Cigar Club Turtles which Mr. Carvey has some fun jokes on and Mr. Spiner's character smokes its cigars. But, there really is a Turtle Club out there. It is a secret society. I hear that Johnny Cash is a Turtle. An ex-boyfriend of mine is a Turtle. I may count as a Turtle, too, because I know the secret answer to the secret question. Anyrate, I laughed all of the way through and saw it 2 extra times for good measure and I don't normally watch SNL because I'm bizzy watching BritComs a lot on Saturday Nights on our local PBS station. But, this was indeed a very funny movie. Go see it, if you haven't. Niche markets that might enjoy the film are: SNL audience, Star Trek audience, other actors/actresses/personalities' fans such as Jesse Ventura, Turtles, Alpha Phi Omega National Service Fraternity (most APOs are usually Turtles also), and ages 10-mid-twenties or whenever most people outgrow bathroom humor. But, older people may enjoy it also. The movie has the added flavor of most of the actors/actresses having had stage experience. There is always a different feel to T.V. and movie stuff when the actors are people who are used to performing live, on stage for some reason. Maybe it is the over-the-top feel which more recent Star Trek series tend to be lacking on. It is your basic silly movie that I've heard Patrick Stewart say is, "America's gift to the world." (our silliness)

When Dana produced this movie, he wanted one that his kids could see without there being anything bad in it. When it came out, I was 18. Even though I knew it was going to be a kids movie, I still wanted to see it because of Dana Carvey. Being a kids movie and knowing his motivation, I wasn't expecting some blockbuster comedy that apparently most of the other critics of this movie were. It's a silly stupid kids movie with ridiculous slap stick! If you go into it expecting anything more than that last sentence, you are going to be disappointed. Otherwise, prepare for some good belly laughs! I came on here today to look up this movie again because a line popped into my head. If I had access to my parents' DVD collection, I'd be sitting down to watch it with my little girl tonight!!!

review_title: An inept waiter finds he has inherited the role of "Master of Disguise" and must fight evil and injustice.
review_detailed_main:
I rate this extremely silly movie highly because my kids (ages 6 and 9) loved it. It also contains fairly harmless fun featuring some slapstick slapping and a recurring fart joke. There is no cursing.

I like Dana Carvey, but had trouble enjoying this film during my initial viewing as I kept trying to make sense of the absurd plot. During subsequent viewings (Those with kids know what I mean), I gave up on that, and I too found myself looking forward to each ridiculous Carvey incarnation.

Some of the characterizations are classic Carvey that have been shoehorned into the plot (Al Pacino's Scarface as a disco dancer, Robert Shaw from Jaws), while others are just over the top silly (Turtleman!). But like I said, kids love it. It's the sort of innocent fun that allows you to leave the room guilt free if you don't like Dana Carvey.

I don't know what everybody is talking about. I'm 18 and in college and I'm still watching the movie and I think it's hilarious. I've seen it way more that any other movie out there. People just need a sense of humor and not be so serious. Obviously the acting isn't incredible but it's just clever enough to be freaking hilarious. I've never met anybody who doesn't think this movie is awesome. I'm just gonna write about random crap now cause I think that 10 lines is kind of ridiculous. I couldn't even write 10 lines about a classic like Mr. Bean. I can say what I want to say about a movie in about 4 lines. and there we go.

review_title: You can't over think this movie.
review_detailed_main: This movie may not be the greatest movie ever but I got a kick out of it when i watched it. Basically it was so stupid it was funny. If you are a person like me that likes stupid movies you will enjoy this one. It's the kind of movie you watch when you are bored on a friday night.

The Master of Disguise is a fair comedy film that has a good cast which includes Dana Carvey, Brent Spiner, Jennifer Esposito, Harold Gould, James Brolin, with Erick Avari, Jessica Simpson, Bo Derek, Paula Abdul, and Jesse Ventura! The acting by all of these actors is very good. Carvey is really excellent in this film. I thought that he had an excellent performance! Gould and Spiner also have good performances! The comedy is really good. The movie is filmed very good. The music is good as well. The film is quite funny and some of the stuff is just so hilarious. Currently this film has 2.8 at 10 stars and is at the bottom 100: #57. In My opinion this movie doesn't deserve it because its just plain silly and there isn't many films like this one. This is a fair film. If you like Dana Carvey, Brent Spiner, Jennifer Esposito, Harold Gould, James Brolin, the rest of the cast in the film, Comedies, and Action then I strongly recommend you to see this film today!

This is a very misunderstood movie - this is a KID'S FILM. Carvey made it for his kids. If you and bunch of buddies got ripped and went out he theatre to see it - yeah, I can see how you would be disappointed. It's not Austin Powers, it's not the Farrelly Brothers, it's not even Ivan Reitman. But my 7 year old and her friends LOVED it - and she has seen Keaton, Chaplin, the Marx Brothers, etc. and she adores them (and no, I am not comparing for a second Carvey to these legends but there is no way he deserves the crap he's getting for this film). The film is silly, flawed, badly edited but also has some very funny set pieces and some great throwaway dialogue ("this is what you are doing, this is what I need you to do" "Turtle harm" "You are the conductor of the potty train", etc.) Fun for the kids. Plain and simple. But, jeez, compared to some Sandler or Schneider disasters, this film deserves better treatment from viewers.

review_title: Come on, guys, it's a kid movie, not 007!!!
review_detailed_main:
I am disappointed in everyone who voted negatively against this

movie. I hadn't seen it in the theater, but saw Dana Carvey on The

View talking about it, so I rented it. He said he wrote it for 8 year

old kids! Come on, guys, it's AWESOME for that age group. In fact,

my 4 year old and 7 year old LOVED it! They watched it 7 times in

5 days! (Please don't take offense at this, I don't usually let them

watch that much TV, but they really loved it. I probably won't buy it

for that very reason!) My 4 year old son still quotes Pistachio all the

time and just laughs and laughs! He keeps asking, "Mom,

remember that part in "Masters of the Sky"?" So, all you people

who are dissing this movie, just stop it! Go analyze dramas and

thrillers and leave the great people who are making good kid

movies alone!

For my purposes, this title gets a 8 out of 10. Five for the movie itself, an extra two points for Mr. Spiner's diamond blue eyes, and one for the set designer who had the presence of mind to arrange Spiner's character's color scheme around them. Everything around "Devlin Bowman" is blue and white and the effect is quite striking.

The movie is a ninety minute fart joke. I'm not kidding.

Harold Gould, by far and away, delivers the best overall performance in the movie (such as it is). Casting James Brolin in this movie was a definite stroke of completely ridiculous genius. Austin Wolff is, of course, adorable, and Dana Carvey's particular brand of multiple personality disorder is as entertaining as ever (I got a definite chuckle out of Mr. Peru).

Like I said, the movie is a ninety minute fart joke and is quite clearly directed at males between the ages of eight and twelve. If you have a roomful of those kind of people and you'd like them to stop breaking things by playing baseball with the ceiling fan, this movie will at least put them all in one room and occupy them with disgusting noises for about an hour and a half. There's no swearing. The (incredibly) mild "blue" content is really tame and based on a cartoony visual gag, as is the "violence". It's supposed to be a silly, sight gag based comedy and that's exactly what it is.

As for Spiner (you knew I was getting to it); first of all, he's gorgeous. Like I said, the character's entire color scheme is a shade of electric blue that compliments his eyes to the point of being captivating. I was hitting the pause button just because I *had* to look. The jokes are (of course) at his character's expense (he *is* the bad guy, after all), and he, appropriately, rolls out his very best "smarmy/irritated" act (the one that stole "Out To Sea" right out from under two legends). It's amusing and relatively gentle right up until the climax of the movie, where he hits the "crazy button" and doesn't look back. Then it's just plain hilarious. In terms of Spiner-related content, I got exactly what I wanted out of this movie and just a little bit more.

By the way, Classmates.com owes Spiner a big, wet kiss (trust me).

review_title: See a Saturday matinee with lots of kids!
review_detailed_main: Master of Disguise was a great kid's flick. You'll enjoy it more if there are lots of kids in the audience to help get you laughing at some of the silly humor. The gags are funny and the humor is clean.

I don't understand how so many people hate this movie! I think it's just gang mentality or something because this is a really funny movie. Is it a good movie? Hell no! What kind of fool would walk into "Master of Disguise" expecting a solid piece of captivating story telling? Master of Disguise is nothing more than a bunch of childish jokes and impressions that are thrown in for no good reason other than to showcase carvie's talent. And guess what? they're hilarious! The best thing about this movie is everyone involved knows the movie is just ridiculous but the cast puts everything they've got into it anyway and play their characters as if they were serious.

I could imagine kids would laugh at this like crazy! I love the joke about how the disguisees only like women with huge hips and in one scene the dana carvie and his uncle are admiring this fat lady from behind, but then the lady turns around and its this fat guy with a beard wearing a dress!!! both of them recoil in disgust! Stupid? yes but it works for some reason. I enjoyed it a lot!

I recently went to see "Master of Disguise", Dana Carvey's new "movie". I put the word "movie" in quotes because I think the word "exposé" would better encompass the thing that I saw. Countless times during the show I found myself asking "What the f***?" Nevertheless, it was incredibly humorous. At times I didn't know if it was a kid's movie or if it should have had a higher rating that it's PG. It left me dumbfounded and confused, yet delightfully elated. I agree with the guy above when he says:

"One cannot begin to hopefully comprehend or decipher all the psychological & stereotypical boundaries this film breaks. It is a surprise to find this film in mainstream theaters as a film on this level & caliber would normally only be found in the finest arthouse theaters. If you plan on seeing Master of Disguise, I suggest keeping your afternoon free, as after viewing, no after witnessing it, you'll need the rest of the afternoon to invest in deciphering the dense narrative."

If humor is caused by the momentary break down of logic in our brains or surprising results, this movie takes full advantage of each of these. It definitely had the feel of Dana Carvey, reminiscent of his short-lived TV show. I highly recommend it, since few others probably will.

Hilarious!! Such a great film!!! When I first saw Master of Disguise I was a little taken by surprise at the amount of slapstick comedy, and felt it went too over the top at times, as I had had doubts that this film was a little too young for me. But then I watched it again properly and it grew on me. I found that I enjoyed Dana Carvey's performance and realised that this film was funny, better than that. Harold Gould was the balance back from the comedy though also inputted some himself which I found was well put in. Brent Spiner as the "bad guy" was a perfect match and played his part brilliantly opposite Carvey, Gould and Brolin. This film was brought to its great level by the story and the way it appeals to children and Carvey's character with his simplicity. I also think this film was one of the great ways to allow Carvey to use his talent of impersonation in the big screen. I had personally not heard of him before this film and am now finding myself looking for more of his work. I have now watched the film quite a few times and still enjoy it. Anyone who has a great and slightly weird sense of humour like me should find it a laugh very enjoyable.

review_title: I become another person by Hindu magic becoming another person
review_detailed_main: Pistachio is a real nut case in this film. But once he observes his Grandfathers advice he quickly learns how to become another person. Using Hindu magic he learns to become another person. Once he becomes another person then he can pursue being a "Master of Disguise". This movie seems kinda like the dumbest re-make of Mission Impossible ever. Becoming another person to stop the world's most flagellate man from collecting art in the form of rare political articles seems to be the movies objective. Data from the movie series Star Trek Next Generation needs to be using the political form of propaganda used by Portugese and Spanish talk shows to model for Beano. (Ohio State's political and congressional gas buster of choice.)

review_title: Why is it in the Bottom 100?
review_detailed_main:
I actually came on this page of IMDb to see how HIGH the score was. I thought it would be in the 7's. How wrong I was! But does it really deserve such a low score? The answer is no in my opinion. This was a freaking hilarious movie and Dana Carvey did a really great job in his role. Sometimes it was a little goofy but that's Dana Carvey's style. I don't know why people hated it. I happen to love it and I think a lot of the little ones will enjoy it as well.

So if your looking for a funny movie with cute humor I think you'll enjoy it. I mean, I did. Ignore all the other comments because they obviously don't know what they're talking about. I think they had it confused with "The Notebook".

review_title: Classic Dana Carvey, Hysterical Family Fun
review_detailed_main:
The only way that you can't enjoy Dana Carvey is if you take yourself way too seriously, you have absolutely no sense of humor, or you've been jaded by the junk spewed from the bowels of Disney and other movie houses that mass produce flicks that purport to be entertaining. From his days with Saturday Night Live, when he kept audiences in stitches with his rendition of Church Lady and Hanz and Franz, Dana Carvey is, hands down, one of the best comedians, and this movie has been long in coming.

Compared to the summer's other highly touted offerings for kids -- Lilo & Stitch, Scooby Doo, Crocodile Hunter, et. al. -- The Master of Disguise wins, hands down. Not only was it truly targeted toward its audience with a lack of cursing, but the crude humor that accompanies any SNL's performance was far enough over the head of the kids in the audience that only the parents were laughing.

Obviously, the movie wasn't intended to have a plot that will garner any Oscar nominations. That was never the point. It's mindlessly stupid, which is what Dana Carvey is all about. But when you enter the theater, you know that. So you sit back with your drink and your candy, take a deep breath, and get ready to laugh your way through the entire thing, which is exactly what all 9 of us did.

Thanks, Dana Carvey, for giving my kids and me one good laugh at this movies this summer before heading back to school.

....if you are a boy aged between 4 and 10. At this age boys do not need to be lobotomised as they are already that daft. Every joke, skit and look is aimed at this age range and if that's too much for your sophisticated adult brain then shame on you. It was a joy to watch my 3 sons laughing and enjoying themselves so much. Dana Carvey's geek character is one that all small boys can relate to (trapped as they are in their own sometimes unresponsive bodies) and being the totally stupid good guy who wins, for me sends a better message than other kids movies that say the biggest bombs win.

Who's the Daddy? Dana Carvey must be one for sure.

Okay...so The Master of Disguise doesn't have the greatest plot. But just because a movie doesn't have a good plot does not always mean that it isn't good. The Master of Disguise is a comedy movie. That's what we have to look at it as. The majority of all comedy movies don't have very good plots-mostly because their meant to be funny-not to have a good plot. I've watched The Master of Disguise a minimum of 25 times, and I still enjoy watching it. The humor never gets old. So give The Master of Disguise a break, people...it's a comedy, not some action-adventure movie.

review_title: Not even half as bad as it looked.
review_detailed_main:
I guess most people watching this film will be expecting some sort of cross between Carvey's "Blank Slate" and his role of Garth in "Wayne's World".

Unfortunately this movie is aimed at 8-12 year old kids and so fans may be disappointed. The jokes are usually immature sometimes and mainly consist of Carvey disguising himself as different wacky characters and doing impressions. Here is where the problem lies. While the impressions range from good (Tony Montana) to hysterically funny (Quint from Jaws) to downright surreal (Turtle Turtle) the plot in between and the actual jokes are a little on the poor side.

The biggest problem is the editing. The third act in particular seems to have about 15 mins of plot sliced out of it and there are some noticeable holes in the story. In fact the whole ending seems to have not been completely filmed. This makes an already silly movie very difficult to follow at times and the film ends at just under 77 mins.

Many of these faults could be attributed to the fact that the film is aimed at pre-teens, however in this case they have no excuse. Most of the cast are good comedic actors and watching this film you can see the humour trying to get out, you know this film could have succeeded if they had just tried a little harder.

Instead we are left with a film that will make you laugh if you watch it with your kids, but will never fully entertain anyone, not even the audience it was intended for. 5 out of 10.

I think that this movie was really funny. At first i was not interested in it, but my friends made me go, and when i saw it, I went to go see it again next time. This movie was a really funny comedy, and i think that everyone should see it. This movie is "two thumbs up." I think that the movie would probably be the "funniest movie of the year." Go see it, and trust me you will like it, because it is hilarious, and incredibly funny!!!!

review_title: Come on guys this film was damn funny.
review_detailed_main:
Ill admit that theres a lot of slapstick humour here, but it was Very funny, I can only assume that its because of the yankee sense of humour which only seems to understand certain types of humour, so U dont get a lot of English humour like "Fawlty Towers", the many "Monty Python" films, "Benny Hill", Frank Spencer in "Some Mothers do 'ave 'em", "Steptoe and Son" - The list in endless.

All I can say is that this film does NOT deserve to be listed in the worst 100 films.

Its people like you that stopped "Serving Sara" to be released in this country, even though I have watched it and found it thouroughly enjoyable too, not quite as hilarious as this film but close.

I found this movie to be funny, fun, light-hearted, cute, and entertaining. If you are a kid or a kid at heart (as I am), you will enjoy this one.

I laughed out loud on several occasions, and I left the theater with a good feeling.

My husband went to the theater with no expectations, and we left glad that we had given "Master of Disguise" a try. And, no, we didn't go just because of the kids. We are both adults, and we don't have any kids. We just enjoy seeing good, wholesome movies.

If you are hard hearted or the type who doesn't like goofy movies, you may not like it. But I personally enjoyed it tremendously!

I really liked Master of Disguise. It was a great family movie. I was so glad to see Dana Carvey back on the big screen after all the problems he's had. I think people should give Dana SOME credit. Afterall he DID make the movie for his children.

review_title: A fun fluffy movie for the kid in all of us
review_detailed_main: Ok, first of all for the person who made the comment about the positive comments being proof of studio plants, I am not, I repeat, am not a studio plant. Good got that off my chest. Now on to the movie. I laughed so hard, why you ask did I laugh so hard if the plot was fairly weak, and the characters not developed? Because I didn't go to see some meaningful plot with amazing Oscar winning performances, I went to see Dana Carvey do what he does best, make me laugh!!! It's kind of sad when our society needs either foul language, sexual content, or blood and gore to really get them excited(I mean come on, how much more plot and character development does Austin Powers have?) Anyway, some are going to get all upset because, how could I compare Austin Powers to this little movie, well let's see, Austin Powers is mostly about Mike Myers doing his schtick, except he has crude language, sexual innuendo and violence, Master of disguise is abot Dana Carvey being funny with very little sexual stuff(ok I know I know there ARE some scenes, but even that dosen't compare to Austin's blatent stuff) and some slapstick type violence(forgive the pun) Anyway, if you are a kid at heart, are a kid or have kids I think you'll like this movie.

review_title: The BEST, well. my comments are...
review_detailed_main:
All right, I watched this today hoping to find the humor that Dana is known for, and I was sadly disappointed, OK, granted I was not expecting Waynes World.. but I think it could have been better.. who knows, I think it was a sign of the pending doom when I saw it was a Happy Madison production.. (that is for another time) His impressions were always the reason I watched him on SNL.. (Saturday Night Live for those who are Comic impaired) I also agree with another comment about studios wasting money on people that were huge in SNL without seeing a script.. had they read this one the movie might not have been made. and as a hard core Trekkie I found Brent Spiners role.... intriguing.. to say the least.. and the fart jokes.. OK.. the first couple made me laugh.. but I was really expecting them to go somewhere.. HA..

Oh well I had to give it a 10 just to save it from the bottom of the list, but a 4 may be more than it deserves

review_title: The most amazing film in the world!!!!!!!!
review_detailed_main: The only way that you couldn't find this movie as funny as most people is if you live in a cave and your name is bin laden. Fair enough you need a specific taste, but if you liked the Wayne's world films and Saturday night live, you will truly appreciate this film for what it is, the one most innovative, most extravagant, most excellent film in the history of the world!!!! So if you don't like it, don't comment, and find yourself a girlfriend if you can!! Good Luck with that! Dana Carvey is a god to all middle aged men and child alike, if you can't, don't or won't find him funny, you don't deserve to have ears or eyes!!!!!!! I think that you all deserve to be shot, but that is my personal opinion!!! I've been Daniel Sherwood and you've been magnificent, thank you and goodnight!!!!

review_title: You idiots! How can you hate this?
review_detailed_main: I thought this was a great film, I laughed my ass off! Can't you pinkos sit back and enjoy the finer points of this...dare I say it? Classic. I mean sure, like any other film, it had its rougher elements such as Pistasicios mother who I disliked immensely (and who was a voice in a cartoon I can't put my finger on) but I though this hardly affected the plot. I especially liked the villains' farting jokes (yeah, that's right) not to mention the Lincoln speech, man that bit cracked me up. But what confuses me is that you people couldn't handle the silliness of the film, the weight of your reality has destroyed your viewing pleasure. You might have gotten used to your linear life of work, family, weekend leisure in a constant cycle, but perhaps you don't realise the damage it has done to your mind and soul. Also being your inability to appreciate the humour of a child (I'm 15 so it hasn't escaped me yet fortunately) A good film, not a perfect one mind you yet still worth watching if you have the soul.

"Master of Disguise" is a wonderfully fun family movie, packed full of colorful cinematography, playful characterization and innocent humor.

I loved Dana Carvey's caricatures of the well known film characters that we all know and love; particularly the Al Paccino based "Mister Peru" (satisical of the movie "scarface") and, Jaws's "Quint" character (origionaly played My Robert Shaw) were incredibly amusing as i'm a big fan of both movies found Carveys versions brilliant.

This is one of my favorite "chear me up movies" and, the first movie I play when i'm entertaining my numerous nieces, nephews and younger siblings.

When I first saw this movie, I was a child and loved it as did other kids at my school. It had so many funny moments. It wasn't until years later that I learned how many negative reviews it had. I'm not sure why that is. This movie was made to make kids laugh, and I believe it succeeded in doing that. I still find it hilarious even now. If you watch this movie without expectations, then you might enjoy it too. It's silly, but there's always room for silliness in comedy. I will always consider it a classic. So, make yourself some spaghetti with man-sized meatballs and watch Master Of Disguise right now.

review_title: This is quality in comparison to many films released lately
review_detailed_main: Not sure whose grandma's have been writing all the terrible reviews and rating this gem of a movie so poorly, but as for me and my house this is a good movie. Humor is dead, and everyone is a jaded critic. We sit on our couches and click our buttons to entertain, and then if we feel frustrated or upset about what we've subjected ourselves to then it's off to practice our cynical, hyperbolic ramblings for all the anonymous avatars to like and react. One might argue that in writing said review I myself have engaged in precisely such a hypocrisy. To that I'd reply this is true, however it doesn't count when I engage is such futility, for being the beacon of unbridled truth that I am I am able to throw off all hindrances in articulation of the upmost importance, and declare to you, the reader here in this moment that this is indeed despite all the evidence to the contrary a quality production worthy of the iota of honor and respect that modern man is still capable of giving.

This little movie has become one of our family's all time favorites. Honestly, we watch it over and over again, quote it to each other, show it to other people. No, it's not a great movie; but it is a funny movie. You just have to have a taste for silliness, a childlike taste.

When the nefarious Devlin Bowman (Brent Spiner) kidnaps his legendary father (James Brolin), Pistachio Disguisey (Dana Carvey) has to learn the ways of "Energico" and go to the rescue -- not just of his parents but of numerous national treasures besides. Ably helped by an assistant Jennifer (Jennifer Esposito) and his mystical grandfather (Harold Gould), Pistachio slowly becomes the Master of Disguise.

Carvey, who has always cracked me up anyway, whirls through an army of loopy characters -- Granny Num-Nums, Mr. Peru, Terry Suave, Constable Muller, Cherry Pie Man ("Look! It's Cherry Pie Man!," like everybody knows him), and the great Turtle Man. There are also Robert Shaw from Jaws and even President George W. Bush at a crucial moment.

The DVD (yes, we own it) special features show those weren't all he had in mind -- Mayor Maynot is so well done, but was cut out completely, for instance.

Special kudos to Spiner, who was evil, and Esposito, who played along hilariously. And the guy offering hors d'oeuvres to Mr. Peru, just for keeping a straight face.

The Italian accents are uniformly awful, I'll admit, and the gags are sometimes dopey. But they're funny dopey, not painful dopey. If you're not too sophisticated to enjoy a simply enjoyable movie, rent this movie or pick it up for $5 at Half Price Books like we did. Watch it with some kids, about 10 years old. It will be difficult for you to stop laughing.

In a world of horrible movies(rainman,braveheart,pulp fiction) you need a good movie once in a while. That's why this flick is so great. Whoever doesnt like it has a few screws loose and this movie should definetly win best picture at next years academy awards with no-contest whatsoever. 10 out of 10 for excellence. Great plot too!
